0.title: Apple sets Sept 5 deadline for employees to start returning to office 3 days a week
0.article_body: Apple has set a September 5 deadline for its corporate employees to be in the office at least three days per week, according to internal emails. The company will require employees to work from the office on Tuesdays, Thursdays and a third day determined by individual teams. Apple's hybrid work model, announced in June 2021, was delayed earlier this year.

1.title: Delhi witnesses less than 2,000 new COVID cases for 1st time in 12 days
1.article_body: Delhi on Monday reported 1,227 new COVID-19 cases and eight coronavirus-related deaths. This is the first time in 12 days that the daily COVID-19 cases in Delhi have been below the 2,000 mark. Notably, the daily COVID-19 positivity rate in the national capital has risen to 14.57%, compared to 12.64% on Sunday. Delhi has witnessed 19,85,822 COVID-19 cases since 2020.

2.title: Kylian Mbappe calls Messi and Ronaldo 'the greedy two'
2.article_body: PSG forward Kylian Mbappe said the Ballon d'Or award was "crushed by the greedy two", Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo. "Frankly, everything is crushed by the greedy two...that battle was pretty crazy," he said. When asked to choose between the two, Mbappe said that he couldn't as it would be like choosing between a father or mother.

3.title: 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign boosted sales of Tricolour: Traders
3.article_body: To commemorate 75 years of Indian independence, the Centre launched the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign which helped increase the demand and sales of the tricolour, traders and flag makers said. "There has been unprecedented demand for the national flag this year...We have already supplied 10 lakh pieces of the national flag," said Mumbai-based The Flag Company's Co-founder Dalvir Singh Nagi.

4.title: Kashmiris threatened to hoist national flag: Mehbooba Mufti
4.article_body: Former J&K CM and Peoples Democratic Party President Mehbooba Mufti said that people in Kashmir were threatened and made to hoist the Tricolour. In a series of tweets, she said, "J&K administration shamelessly boasts about Kashmiris hoisting Indian flag. Truth is they were threatened to do so or else face the consequences." She called the government's patriotism "pseudo and monetised".

5.title: Senior Kenyan election officials disown presidential poll results
5.article_body: The deputy chairperson of Kenya's election commission and three other commissioners on Monday disassociated themselves with the results of the recently concluded presidential elections. "We are not able to take ownership of the results that will be announced," deputy chairperson Juliana Cherera announced. This came shortly before the announcement of the results by the election commission.

6.title: Suryakumar is a bit like De Villiers, no. 4 is his best batting spot: Ponting
6.article_body: Comparing India batter Suryakumar Yadav with AB de Villiers, Ricky Ponting said the India batter scores 360 degrees around the ground, a bit like the ex-South African cricketer. "The lap shots, the late cuts...the ramps over the keeper's head," he added. Talking about Suryakumar's batting spot in India's squad, Ponting said number four is the 31-year-old's best spot.

7.title: Namibian cheetahs to be brought to MP given health checkups
7.article_body: Cheetahs from Namibia, which could soon be settled into Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park, were given their first health check-up by an international team of experts. The Indian High Commission in Windhoek tweeted photos of the animals undergoing the examination. Last month, India signed an MoU with Namibia to reintroduce the animals back into the wild.

8.title: Used to prepare the night before, getting our kites ready: Kohli on I-Day childhood memory
8.article_body: Talking about his childhood memories of Independence Day, Virat Kohli said, "In Delhi...there's a big culture of flying kites on 15th August...so that used to be a super special moment." He added, "We all used to prepare a lot the night before, getting our kites and everything ready...so that we can find a good time and go to fly kites."

9.title: What are the features of the Made-in-India howitzer used for I-Day gun salute?
9.article_body: The Made-in-India howitzer ATAGS was used in the customary 21-gun salute during the Independence Day ceremony for the first time ever at the Red Fort on Monday. The long-range artillery gun with a 48-km maximum range was developed by DRDO. It has advanced features ensuring quick deployability, high mobility, an automatic command and control system and an advanced communication system.

10.title: Shakira to relocate to Miami amid tax fraud claims: Reports
10.article_body: Pop star Shakira is reportedly leaving Spain to relocate to Miami amid the alleged tax fraud case. Her family friend and Douglas Elliman realtor Ana Lourdes Martinez described Miami as Shakira's "refuge". Shakira is accused of failing to pay taxes between 2012 and 2014, a period during which she claimed she was living in the Bahamas.

11.title: More than deserved: Alcaraz on fellow Spaniard Busta's 1st 1000 Masters title
11.article_body: Following Spaniard Pablo Carreño Busta's maiden ATP 1000 Masters title in Montreal, compatriot Carlos Alcaraz said, "Pablo!!!! Congratulations and more than deserved! Happy for you!" Argentina's Diego Schwartzman said, "Giant pablito. A great partner/friend...Congratulations." Busta beat Hubert Hurkacz 3-6, 6-3, 6-3 in Sunday's final. Busta is the sixth Spaniard to win an ATP Tour title this year.

12.title: CWG 2022 medal winners from Haryana to be honoured on Aug 16
12.article_body: The Commonwealth Games 2022 medal winners from Haryana will be honoured by the state government in Gurugram on Tuesday. The gold, silver and bronze medallists will be awarded ₹1.5 crore, ₹75 lakh and ₹50 lakh respectively. However, all participating athletes from Haryana will get ₹7.5 lakh. Notably, Haryana's sportspersons won 20 medals, including nine gold medals, in CWG 2022.

13.title: Stoinis to not face sanction for accusing Pak bowler Hasnain of chucking
13.article_body: Australian cricketer Marcus Stoinis will not face any formal sanction for questioning Pakistani pacer Mohammad Hasnain's bowling action during their match in The Hundred. Stoinis was spoken to by match referee Dean Cosker after the incident. The controversy took place after Hasnain took Stoinis' wicket with a quicker delivery during the match.

14.title: Snapchat+ crosses 1 million paid subscribers within 6 weeks from launch
14.article_body: Snapchat's parent company, Snap Inc, on Monday said that the company's paid subscription plan Snapchat+, which launched in June, now has over one million subscribers across the globe. According to a report, Snap had registered $7.3 million in in-app revenue within 30 days of Snapchat+ launch. Snap also introduced four new features for Snapchat+.

15.title: Arsene Wenger names Henry among his 7 favourite Arsenal players
15.article_body: Arsenal's longest-serving manager Arsene Wenger named seven players when he was asked to name his favourite player from his time with the club. Thierry Henry, Dennis Bergkamp, Patrick Vieira, Robert Pires, Jack Wilshere, Aaron Ramsey and Cesc Fabregas were the players Wenger mentioned. Wenger had managed the London club from 1996 to 2018.

16.title: ICC needs to put more time to ensure ODI, Test survival: Kapil Dev
16.article_body: Former India captain Kapil Dev urged the ICC to put more time into ensuring survival of ODI and Test cricket. "I think it's fading out...ICC has to put more time...(to) ensure survival of one-day cricket, Test match cricket," said Kapil Dev. He said he fears international cricket would be played only during the World Cup.

17.title: Honoured to receive your I-Day wishes: PM Modi to Mauritius PM
17.article_body: After being wished on the occasion of India completing its 75 years of Independence, PM Narendra Modi thanked Mauritius Prime Minister Pravind Kumar Jugnauth. "Honoured to receive your Independence Day wishes. India and Mauritius have very deep cultural linkages. Our nations are also cooperating in a wide range of subjects for the mutual benefit of our citizens," PM Modi said.

18.title: All Australians applaud India’s successes: Aus PM Anthony Albanese
18.article_body: Australian PM Anthony Albanese wished India on completing 75 years of Independence and said that "all Australians applaud India's successes". "We also give thanks for the contribution of our Indian-Australian community to our society...and to the links between our nations," he said. Meanwhile, PM Narendra Modi replied, "The friendship between India and Australia has stood the test of time."

19.title: Tourist ban shouldn't make life harder for Kremlin critics: Germany
19.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Monday said that any decision regarding a proposed entry ban on Russian tourists in EU should not make it harder for critics of Russian leadership to flee the country. Several EU leaders have called for a ban on the entry of Russian tourists into the bloc's territory over the ongoing invasion of Ukraine by Russia.

20.title: Pietersen sends I-Day wishes to Indian fans through tweet in Hindi, fans correct him
20.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen took to Twitter to wish his Indian fans on India's 76th Independence Day in Hindi. Several fans pointed out mistakes in his tweet, with one saying, "Please don't use Google Translate." Another wrote, "Stand tall doesn't equate to 'lamba khade raho'...but we got your emotions." Another user mentioned it's India's 76th Independence Day not 75th.

21.title: Meta partners with DoorDash for delivery of Marketplace items in US: Reports
21.article_body: Online delivery platform DoorDash and Meta have partnered to deliver Facebook Marketplace items in US. The items will only be delivered within a radius of 25 km and need to be small enough to fit in the trunk of a car. Currently, it has not been made clear how much it would cost to use DoorDash to make the deliveries.

22.title: Criticism of judiciary must be within bounds: India's next Chief Justice
22.article_body: India's next Chief Justice Uday Umesh Lalit on Monday said, "The public has the right to see whether our judgments are up to the expectations of society or not." However, he added, there must be a line that should be drawn. "Any criticism is a pointer that even...judiciary can do...course corrections...but that criticism should be within bounds," he added.

23.title: CA aiming for cricket's inclusion at Brisbane Olympics in 2032
23.article_body: Cricket Australia is aiming to include cricket in the 2032 Brisbane Olympics. The target is part of a five-year strategic plan named 'Where the Game Grows', which includes nine targets. "This strategy contains both a vision and a clear plan for how we can achieve bold, transformative change while also meeting our core responsibilities," CA CEO Nick Hockley said.

24.title: Johnny Depp to direct first film after 25 years
24.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp will be directing Italian painter Amedeo Modigliani's biopic, which reportedly will be co-produced by Al Pacino. The film will be his first direction in 25 years after 'The Brave' (1997). The actor said he is "incredibly honoured, humbled" to bring Modigliani's story on screen. He called it a story of "great hardship, but eventual triumph".

25.title: No one can ignore Savarkar's role in India's freedom struggle: Sena MP
25.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi said nobody can ignore Vinayak Damodar Savarkar's role in India's freedom struggle and added that India runs on the energy and principles of Mahatma Gandhi. "Every contribution by different freedom fighters played a significant role in independence," she said. "If PM Narendra Modi mentioned Gandhi's name, I hope he follows his path too," she added.

26.title: PM took Mahatma Gandhi's name, hope he follows his path: Shiv Sena MP
26.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi on Monday took a swipe at PM Narendra Modi, saying she hopes he follows the path of Mahatma Gandhi as he mentioned 'Bapu' in his Independence Day address. She said that the role played by VD Savarkar can't be ignored, adding that every freedom fighter's contribution played a significant role in India's independence.

27.title: EV startup Faraday Future to raise funding of $600 mn
27.article_body: Electric Vehicle startup Faraday Future Intelligent Electric Inc said that it will raise funding of $600 million. As part of a new financing facility, the startup will receive an $52 million of committed funds. The EV maker said that it is in talks with investors in US and globally for additional near-term funding.

28.title: Civil aviation sector's safety, security is paramount: Scindia
28.article_body: Union Minister for Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia has said that the safety and security of the country's civil aviation space is "paramount". "We make sure that every occurrence is reported," Scindia said. He added, "For both safety and security, we have the regulators in place that monitor compliance on those parameters. BCAS for security and DGCA for safety."

29.title: US sanctions 3 Liberian officials including President's top aide
29.article_body: The US imposed sanctions on three government officials of Liberia on Monday for their alleged involvement in "ongoing public corruption", the Treasury Department informed. One of the sanctioned individuals is President George Weah's chief of staff, Nathaniel McGill. "These officials have undermined democracy in Liberia for their own personal benefit," a senior Treasury Department official stated.

30.title: American billionaire investor Daniel Loeb's Third Point re-invests in Disney
30.article_body: American billionaire investor Daniel Loeb's hedge fund Third Point has announced a new stake in Disney, months after it partially liquidated its stake in the firm. In a letter to Disney CEO, Loeb also suggested a slew of changes, including a spin-off of its sports network ESPN, reports said on Monday. Shares of Disney reportedly jumped 2% on the news.

31.title: Omicron-specific COVID-19 vaccine for India expected in 6 months: SII's Poonawalla
31.article_body: Serum Institute of India's (SII) CEO Adar Poonawalla has said that a COVID-19 vaccine that specifically targets the Omicron variant is expected in India in the next six months, reports said on Monday. SII is the world's biggest vaccine maker and it manufactures the Oxford/AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine, sold as Covishield in India.

32.title: Harshal Patel shares video from injury rehab, says 'Back to the grind'
32.article_body: Pacer Harshal Patel, who was ruled out of India's Asia Cup 2022 squad due to a rib injury, posted a video on Instagram undergoing rehabilitation at National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru. "Back to the grind!! Sometimes the silver lining with injury is that it allows you the time to train without thinking about competition, which is precious," he wrote.

33.title: Will you hit the streets if CBI comes for me?: WB CM to TMC cadre
33.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee at a rally on Sunday asked TMC supporters if they would hit the streets if the CBI reaches her doorstep. "What will you do if they reach my house tomorrow? Will you not hit the streets?" asked Mamata to the crowd. Bengal BJP asked if her statement was an "admission of involvement in corruption".

34.title: India donates 15,000 cycles to Madagascar on 76th Independence Day
34.article_body: On the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day, India has donated 15,000 cycles to Madagascar "as a symbol of growing cooperation" between the countries, Indian Embassy in Madagascar said. India announced the donation on June 3, which is World Bicycle Day. Meanwhile, the Town Hall in Madagascar's Antananarivo had also lit up in tricolour to mark India's independence.

35.title: Man throws bomb after clash between 2 families; 12-yr-old dead, 15 injured
35.article_body: A 12-year-old boy died while 15 people were injured after a man threw a bomb at a rival group during a clash between two families in Madhya Pradesh's Indore district, police said on Monday. Police later raided several houses in the area to find out if there were more bombs. Of the injured persons, the condition of four is critical.

36.title: Ballia man allegedly kills woman with sword for slapping him
36.article_body: A man in UP's Ballia allegedly killed a woman with a sword on Sunday night after she reportedly insulted and slapped him. The police said that the accused surrendered, along with the murder weapon and has been identified as Dilshad Ali Sonu. The victim's family members were also hurt during the attack and are undergoing treatment.

37.title: Tricolour hoisted atop Malkangiri's Maoist memorial for the 1st time
37.article_body: Residents of the tribal-dominated Swabhiman Anchal in Odisha's Malkangiri celebrated Independence Day by hoisting the tricolour at the memorials of Maoist leaders for the first time ever. Earlier, Maoists would hoist black flags in the area as security personnel could not venture into the region. On Monday, security forces also took out a bike rally to celebrate the day.

38.title: Tamil actor Kanal Kannan arrested for provocative speech on Periyar
38.article_body: Tamil actor and stunt choreographer Kanal Kannan, who is also a functionary of the Hindu Munnani, was arrested on Monday for making provocative remarks about Dravidian ideologue EVR Periyar at a gathering in Chennai. In his speech, he sought the demolition of the Periyar statue outside Sri Ranganathar Swamy Temple in Srirangam. Kannan was arrested from Puducherry.

39.title: Karan Johar shares video of his children singing 'Hum Honge Kamyab' on I-Day
39.article_body: Director Karan Johar celebrated the 76th Independence Day with his twins Yash and Roohi. The filmmaker shared a video on Instagram in which his kids were seen singing 'Hum Honge Kamyab'. Along with the video, Karan wrote that the future of India "rests in very stable hands". He said the next generation has the "ultimate power of uniting the nation".

40.title: EAM Jaishankar condoles the loss of lives in Egyptian church fire
40.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday extended condolences to the families of the victims of the fire tragedy that claimed the lives of 41 people in a church in Egypt on Sunday. "Wish a speedy recovery to those injured," he further stated. According to the Egyptian health ministry, 55 people were injured in the incident.

41.title: Snapchat+ adds 4 new features including priority Story replies, post view emoji
41.article_body: Snapchat+, the paid version of the social media app Snapchat, has added four more paid features to the service. The new features include priority Story replies, post view emoji, new Bitmoji backgrounds and new custom app icons. These are in addition to the existing seven features like best friends forever, friend solar system, Snapchat messaging on the web, among others.

42.title: ​Russia ready to arm its allies with modern weapons: Vladimir Putin
42.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Monday that Moscow values its ties with countries in Latin America, Asia and Africa and is ready to offer ammunition to its allies. "[We] are ready to offer our allies the most modern types of weapons, from small arms to armored vehicles and artillery to combat aviation and unmanned aerial vehicles," Putin said.

43.title: Shami's estranged wife dances on 'Des Rangila', urges PM Modi to change India's name
43.article_body: Team India fast bowler Mohammad Shami's estranged wife Hasin Jahan took to Instagram to share a video of herself dancing on 'Des Rangila' on the occasion of Independence Day. She urged PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah to change India's name, stating that the country should only be known as "Bharat" or "Hindustan".

44.title: To be a true Indian is to help others: Sonu Sood
44.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood said that Independence Day reminds people of their duties as Indians. He added that a true Indian is someone who helps others. "To be a true Indian you have to help Indians. Bring a change, bring a smile, and try to save a life," he said. Recently, Sonu announced his audio series 'Commander Karan Saxena'.

45.title: Du Plessis wishes India on I-Day, says 'You are my special home away from home'
45.article_body: On the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day, ex-South Africa captain Faf Du Plessis tweeted, "You are my special home away from home. Congratulations on 75 not out." Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen took to Twitter and wrote, "Be proud and stand tall. You are building a better tomorrow for all!" India is celebrating the 75th anniversary of its independence.

46.title: Nadal not included in Spain squad for Davis Cup, Zverev to lead Germany
46.article_body: Rafael Nadal, who is making his comeback from injury this week, has not been named in Spain's Davis Cup finals group stage squad for next month. Teenager Carlos Alcaraz replaces Nadal in the team. Meanwhile, world number two Alexander Zverev will be leading the German side as he makes a comeback from the ankle injury he picked up in June.

47.title: Mumbai-based The Health Factory raises ₹2 crore in seed funding
47.article_body: Mumbai-based food brand, The Health Factory, has raised ₹2 crore in a seed funding round. The capital was raised from Venture Garage, Happilo founder Vikas Nahar and other angel investors. Founded by Vinay Maheshwari, Jos Vast and Mohit Sankhala, the FMCG company will use the funds raised to scale and streamline operations and take its business to other cities.

48.title: Children and homeless: Kanye West on his biggest inspiration for design
48.article_body: Rapper-designer Kanye West, now formally known as Ye, revealed his inspiration behind his fashion label, Yeezy. He took to his Instagram account on Friday and shared a post that read, "Look to the children/ Look to the homeless as the biggest inspiration for all design." Yeezy is a collaboration between Ye and sportswear company Adidas.

49.title: Starbucks asks labour board to suspend voting for union elections
49.article_body: Starbucks has asked the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) to suspend all union elections at its US stores alleging voter misconduct by NLRB officials and the union. Starbucks said that a  whistleblower called out NLRB officials for acting inappropriately during the Kansas City elections. The company wants to pause mail-in elections and asked all future elections to be held in-person.

50.title: Vignesh Shivan, Nayanthara celebrate I-Day in Spain, share pic
50.article_body: Tamil actress Nayanthara celebrated India's 76th Independence Day in Spain with her husband and filmmaker Vignesh Shivan. The filmmaker shared the photos on his Instagram profile. The pictures show Nayanthara and Vignesh posing with the Tricolour. Later, the actress was also seen enjoying a live performance on the streets of Barcelona.

51.title: Mahindra signs deal with Volkswagen to receive electric vehicle components
51.article_body: Mahindra & Mahindra has signed a term sheet with Volkswagen Group under which it will receive components for its electric vehicles. The cooperation aims at parts for over 1 million vehicles till 2030 and includes equipment of 5 electric SUVs. Mahindra expects 20-30% of its total SUV sales from its electric models by March 2027.

52.title: All 11 life imprisonment convicts in Bilkis Bano gang-rape case released from jail
52.article_body: All 11 life imprisonment convicts in the Bilkis Bano gang-rape case were released from the Godhra sub-jail under the remission policy of the Gujarat government. "A committee formed a few months back took a unanimous decision in favour of remission of all the 11 convicts in the case," Panchmahals collector Sujal Mayatra said. Mayatra headed the panel.

53.title: Sultan Azlan Shah Cup hockey tournament to return after 2 years due to COVID
53.article_body: Sultan Azlan Shah Cup hockey tournament is scheduled to return after a two-year gap due to the COVID-19 pandemic. It will be held in Malaysia from November 16 to 25. World number one Australia, Germany, India, New Zealand and Canada have been invited to the tournament. India have won Sultan Azlan Shah Cup five times.

54.title: I-Day would've been better if India was free from poverty: Mayawati
54.article_body: BSP supremo Mayawati on Monday said Independence Day celebrations would have been better if the country was free from "inflation, fatal poverty, unemployment, illiteracy and health problems". She also called for a pledge to wash away the ills of casteism, communalism, hateful politics and corruption. Mayawati said India has a constitutional responsibility toward the welfare of its people.

55.title: 6 Bihar policemen suspended after jailed ex-RJD leader seen at home
55.article_body: Six Bihar Police officials were immediately suspended after a picture showing ex-RJD leader Anand Mohan, who is serving a life sentence, with his family members surfaced on social media. Mohan, who is lodged at Saharsa jail in Bihar, was brought to Patna on August 12 to be produced in the civil court. Mohan's son Chetan Anand is an RJD MLA.

56.title: Sergio Perez will not replace Lewis Hamilton: Mercedes boss Wolff
56.article_body: Mercedes F1 boss Toto Wolff has rubbished rumours of Red Bull's Sergio Perez replacing seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton in the team. "I've never called Sergio...and haven't been in contact with any other driver," said Wolff. He added that there were discussions with Hamilton to continue with the team for five or even 10 years.

57.title: Citizens' freedom can't be taken away: Siddique Kappan's daughter
57.article_body: On the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day, the nine-year-old daughter of Malayali journalist Siddique Kappan, booked and jailed under UAPA in the Hathras rape case, said that ordinary citizens' freedom can't be taken away. I am the daughter of a journalist who is being denied basic rights available to all citizens, she said.

58.title: Nitish is an amarbel, can't be a tree: Giriraj Singh on Nitish's 20 yrs as CM
58.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar will break record of being CM for 20 years but he's like an "amarbel" (dodder) that'll never become a tree, Union Minister Giriraj Singh said on Monday. "BJP made him CM last year. I challenge Nitish to form his own government," Singh added. Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav used to call Kumar 'Paltu Chacha', Singh said.

59.title: Death toll in Armenian market explosion rises to 6
59.article_body: The death toll in the explosion that ripped through a market in Armenia's capital Yerevan on Sunday has risen to six, the Armenian government said on Monday. According to authorities, 18 people remain missing and at least 61 others have been reported injured. The explosion, that reportedly occurred at a fireworks storage area, started a fire in the Surmalu market.

60.title: Need 5 yrs to change system; did it in Delhi, can do it for India: Kejriwal
60.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said his party "just [needs] five years [to]...change the entire system, from education to health, in the country". "Today, people are asking...why India is still behind several countries...even those that got freedom after us," Kejriwal further said. He also asked Opposition parties to not call schemes provided to ordinary citizens as "freebies".

61.title: Singer Rahul Jain accused of raping costume stylist in his flat after meeting via Insta
61.article_body: An FIR has been registered against Bollywood singer-composer Rahul Jain for allegedly raping a 30-year-old costume stylist in his flat in Mumbai. As per the complaint, Rahul met the costume stylist through Instagram where he praised her work and offered her to become his personal costume stylist. The woman stated that Jain assaulted her when she resisted him.

62.title: Manchester City's Mendy raped women in locked rooms in his UK mansion, court told
62.article_body: Manchester City footballer Benjamin Mendy allegedly locked women in rooms with complicated panic room-style locks and raped them, a UK court was told during a trial against him. The 28-year-old has been accused of raping and sexually assaulting seven different women at his "isolated" UK mansion. Mendy committed the alleged offences with the help of his 'fixer' Louis Matturie.

63.title: TRS leader, who switched from CPI(M), hacked to death in Telangana
63.article_body: TRS leader Tammineni Krishnaiah was hacked to death by assailants in Telangana's Khammam on Monday. The 55-year-old politician, who was murdered shortly after hoisting the tricolour, had recently switched to the TRS from CPI(M). Notably, Telangana CPI(M) Secretary Thammineni Veerabhadram, who happens to be Krishnaiah's cousin, has been accused by his relatives of orchestrating the crime.

64.title: If there's one thing he does not lack is his confidence: Karthik on Shardul
64.article_body: Praising India all-rounder Shardul Thakur, teammate Dinesh Karthik said, "If there's one thing he does not lack is his confidence." He added that what he liked about the 30-year-old was that he had taken "300 domestic wickets" before playing Test cricket and he was able to transfer the confidence of playing at the domestic level to the international level.

65.title: Haven't watched Umran much but his ability to bowl fast is impressive: McGrath
65.article_body: Speaking about India pacer Umran Malik, who consistently bowls over 150 kmph, Glenn McGrath stated, "Haven't seen a huge amount of Umran, but the fact that he can bowl at a good pace is impressive." On fast bowling, McGrath said, "Sheer pace is unique. You can't teach someone to bowl 150-plus, they've got to be able to naturally do that."

66.title: So proud to have India as my adopted country: Arjun Kanungo's South African wife Carla
66.article_body: South African model Carla Dennis, who recently tied the knot with Indian singer Arjun Kanungo, took to Instagram to wish India on its 76th Independence Day. She wrote, "I’m soon to be an Indian citizen and I’m so proud to have you as my adopted country for your incomparable warmth, cultural diversity and scrumptious food."

67.title: Ex-India football head coach uploads incorrect India map on I-Day, apologises
67.article_body: Former Indian men's football team head coach Stephen Constantine uploaded an incorrect India map to wish the nation on its 76th Independence day. The 59-year-old, however, corrected himself on being called out by fans and deleted the tweet. He then tweeted again, writing, "Apologies on the incorrect map posted earlier....Happy Independence Day to Indians the world over."

68.title: Ravindra Jadeja completely out of touch with CSK, likely to leave the team: Reports
68.article_body: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has been completely "out of touch" with CSK management since the conclusion of IPL 2022 and is likely to leave the franchise, as per reports. Jadeja was made CSK captain ahead of IPL 2022 but he left the role midway. He also deleted CSK-related posts from his social media accounts.

69.title: Aadhaar, DBT helped save ₹2 lakh crore from falling into wrong hands: PM Modi
69.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, in his Independence Day speech said that Aadhaar and Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) have helped in saving ₹2 lakh crore from falling into wrong hands in the last eight years. He added, "Those who fled India after looting banks during the tenure of the previous government, we've seized their property and are trying to get them back."

70.title: UP family receives death threats for distributing national flags
70.article_body: A family received death threats for allegedly distributing tricolours on the occasion of Independence Day in Bijnor, Uttar Pradesh on Monday. An unidentified suspect pasted a threat letter outside the residence of Shashi and her husband Arun, police said. After the incident, the family has been provided police protection and an FIR has been lodged.

71.title: 4 booked after rape victim dies during forced abortion in Varanasi
71.article_body: A case has been registered against four individuals for the alleged death of a 22-year-old woman during a forced abortion in Varanasi, police said on Monday. The accused include a driver, his friend, a private hospital's senior official, and a doctor. The driver had allegedly raped the woman, and took her to the private hospital for abortion, as per police.

72.title: Deposed Myanmar leader Suu Kyi sentenced to 6 more years in prison
72.article_body: A Myanmar court on Monday convicted deposed leader Aung San Suu Kyi on additional corruption charges, increasing her earlier 11-year prison sentence by six more years. She was convicted for allegedly abusing her power to rent public land at below-market prices and building a residence with donation money. The trial was held behind closed doors, with no access to media.

73.title: Biggest challenge for Australia is winning Test series in India: McGrath
73.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Glenn McGrath said the biggest challenge for the Australian team is coming to India and beating the home team in the Test series. "We were lucky enough to do it in 2004. You've got to come up with good plans," he added. Australia will tour India for a four-match Test series in February-March 2023.

74.title: 2 teenagers drown while crossing river in Manali
74.article_body: Two teenagers drowned while crossing a river in Himachal Pradesh on Monday. The deceased, identified as Krishit (13) and Rahul (14), died while crossing a culvert over a river in Solang in Kullu's Manali town, police said. Krishit was a resident of Ghoshal village, while Rahul was a resident of Haripur village, police added.

75.title: India, China shouldn't let their politics affect neighbours: Ex-Bhutan PM
75.article_body: Bhutan's ex-PM Tshering Tobgay on Sunday said that India and China shouldn't allow their politics to affect countries "sandwiched" between them. "As long as there’s interference in...internal affairs in the neighbouring countries, I...believe that these countries will find it exceedingly difficult to grow," he added. Separately, Tobgay said that India should be offered a permanent seat in UNSC.

76.title: Pics showing Ambani's Antilia decorated with lights on Independence Day go viral
76.article_body: Pictures and videos of billionaire industrialist Mukesh Ambani's Mumbai residence Antilia decorated with Independence Day-themed lights have gone viral on Twitter. The decorations feature Tricolour and Ashoka Chakra lights. The government had launched the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign to mark 75 years of India's Independence this year and urged people to install Tricolours at home.

77.title: BJP believes it has exclusive right over nationalism: Warring
77.article_body: Punjab Congress President Amarinder Singh Warring said that the "BJP believes it has exclusive right over nationalism". "PM Narendra Modi should have called an all-party meeting and announced a non-partisan programme [for the 76th Independence Day]," Warring said. He also criticised former Congress MLA Sunil Jakhar and accused him of "betraying" Congress in the last Punjab Assembly polls.

78.title: 80-yr-old man falls from terrace while hoisting flag in UP, dies
78.article_body: An 80-year-old man fell to his death while trying to hoist the tricolour on his terrace in UP's Muzaffarnagar on Sunday. The victim, Atmaram Sharma, was keen to participate in government's 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign and was a fitness enthusiast, his family said. He lost his balance while trying to tie the flag to a pole and then fell down.

79.title: 2 groups clash during Tiranga Yatra in UP on I-Day, 1 injured
79.article_body: Two groups clashed during a Tiranga Yatra in the Bangla Bazar area of Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on Independence Day on Monday. A person received minor injuries in the incident and some cars were also damaged, the police said. They added that a group of men from the first yatra pelted stones on the second over some old rivalry.

80.title: Ambassador of France to India asks French people what they love about India, shares video
80.article_body: With India and France completing 75 years of diplomatic ties, Emmanuel Lenain, Ambassador of France to India, took to Twitter to share a video wherein French people were asked what they love about India. In the video, a respondent said, "Jugaad is very important in India. Indians always find a solution." "The culture, the colours, the chaos," said another.

81.title: Federalism with diversity is the foundation of India: Kerala CM
81.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan, in his Independence Day Speech, said, "Federalism laced with rich diversity is the foundation of India." He added that Indian nationalism's "most striking" feature was that it could integrate all languages and cultures. CM Vijayan said the state was moving towards eradicating extreme poverty, the digital divide and addressing the issues of the homeless.

82.title: Rajasthan MLA Panachand Meghwal resigns after 9-yr-old Dalit boy beaten to death
82.article_body: Rajasthan Congress MLA Panachand Meghwal resigned from Atru Assembly seat in Baran district on Monday after a nine-year-old Dalit boy was beaten to death by his school teacher for drinking water from his pot in Jalore. Meghwal said he was deeply hurt by the incident. Meghwal added, "Dalits and deprived communities are being subjected to constant atrocities and torture."

83.title: US' KKR to sell entire 27% stake in Max Healthcare on Tue, to raise ₹9,000 cr
83.article_body: US private equity firm KKR will be selling its entire 27% stake in hospital chain Max Healthcare on Tuesday (August 16) and is likely to raise ₹9,000 crore through the transaction. KKR would be offloading 26.7 crore shares at a price band of ₹350-361.9/share, according to deal terms released on Monday. KKR had acquired the stake in 2018 for ₹80/share.

84.title: Shoppers flee Ikea in China as officials try to lock them in store over COVID-19 scare
84.article_body: A video of shoppers fleeing an Ikea store in China's Shanghai after orders of a sudden lockdown in the store has gone viral online. Shoppers were ordered to be locked down at Ikea after authorities found out that a close contact of a 6-year-old boy, who's an asymptomatic COVID-19 patient, had visited it. Guards were seen restraining the fleeing crowd.

85.title: You amaze me every day, my wonder-Astra: Alia to Ayan on b'day
85.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt wished 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji on his birthday. Sharing some behind-the-scene photos of herself and Ayan from the sets of the upcoming film, Alia wrote, "Happy birthday my wonder-Astra. You amaze me every day! I love you so much." She also wished him "love and light for life". 'Brahmastra' marks Alia's first film with Ayan.

86.title: Took strictest action: Domino's India on viral pics of mops hanging above pizza dough
86.article_body: Domino's India responded after purported pictures of cleaning mops and a toilet brush hanging above trays of pizza dough at one of its outlets in Bengaluru went viral on Twitter. Calling it a "month-old issue", it said that this was an isolated incident and that it had taken the "strictest action against the restaurant in question".

87.title: Want independence from people's judgements: Rashami Desai
87.article_body: On the 76th Independence Day, Rashami Desai said she would like freedom from "the judgemental nature of society", especially on a celebrity's personal life. She said that people need to accept that even celebrities are humans who can make mistakes. She said artists would get their "true independence" only when they "will be judged merely on their ability to perform".

88.title: Mangaluru corporation removes Savarkar banner over SDPI complaints
88.article_body: In Mangaluru, a flex banner naming the Surathkal Junction after Vinayak Damodar Savarkar was removed after workers of the Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) objected against it and notified the police. Mangaluru City Corporation approved the proposal to name the circle after Savarkar. However, since the government has not granted permission, the banner was removed over the complaints.

89.title: John Abraham announces new film ’Tariq’; to release on Aug 15, 2023
89.article_body: On the 76th Independence Day, John Abraham announced his next film, 'Tariq'. The film will release on the Independence Day next year. Sharing the news, John wrote, "Time to celebrate the freedom to tell good stories." The film marks his third collaboration with Bake My Cake Films after 'Batla House' and 'Tehran'.

90.title: 61 empty ZP flats to be converted to working women's hostel in Pune
90.article_body: The Zilla Parishad (ZP) along with the women and children development department is planning to open a working women's hostel in 61 vacant flats of ZP buildings. The hostel will be for female students who are pursuing higher education and working women. The flats will undergo proper renovation, before being turned into a hostel, said Ayush Prasad, CEO at ZP.

91.title: Curfew in Karnataka's Shivamogga after protest over Savarkar's poster on I-Day
91.article_body: Prohibitory orders under CrPC Section 144 were imposed in parts of Shivamogga in Karnataka after Hindu activists protested against attempts to remove a poster of Hindutva ideologue Veer Savarkar on Independence Day. The incident was reported in the Ameer Ahmad circle in the city. The attempt to remove the poster was allegedly made by a group of Tipu Sultan followers.

92.title: Unity Software rejects gaming software firm AppLovin's $17.54 bn takeover offer
92.article_body: Video game software maker Unity on Monday rejected AppLovin Corp's $17.54 billion takeover offer and said it would go ahead with its deal to purchase mobile app monetisation software firm ironSource. The offer wasn't in the shareholders' best interest, Unity said. "The board continues to believe that the ironSource transaction is compelling," said Unity CEO John Riccitiello.

93.title: I bow down to RSS' ideals and patriotism, proud of it: K'taka CM
93.article_body: Responding to Congress' claim that he has become a slave of RSS, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said that he's proud of RSS' ideals and bowed his head to its patriotism. "I'm committed to building the country on those ideals and principles and I'm proud of it," he said. Karnataka CM is RSS' slave, Congress leader Siddaramaiah had said.

94.title: Block website selling 'first copy' of Nike, LV shoes on discount: HC
94.article_body: The Delhi HC has ordered the blocking of a website, which was accused of selling 'first copy' of popular footwear brands like New Balance, Adidas, Louis Vuitton and Nike at highly discounted prices. Justice Navin Chawla, in an order, also sought details and KYC documents of three mobile numbers through which the website 'www.myshoeshop.in' was allegedly offering the products.

95.title: 3 people, including Army personnel, beaten up by 4 bouncers outside Gurugram nightclub
95.article_body: Three people, including an Army personnel, were beaten up by four bouncers outside a nightclub in Gurugram. As per the police, they had asked a bouncer to play music at the club after which the fight occurred.  A case under several sections of the IPC has been filed against the accused at the Gurugram Sector 29 Police Station.

96.title: Chief of Hyd's Rachakonda Police gets President's Police Medal
96.article_body: The Commissioner of Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police, Mahesh Bhagwat, has been awarded the 'President's Police Medal for Distinguished Service' by the Union Home Ministry. Bhagwat, a 1995-batch IPS officer of the Telangana cadre, has been serving as Rachakonda Police chief since 2016. In 2004, Bhagwat had been awarded the 'President's Police Medal for Gallantry'.

97.title: PM Modi doing politics through I-Day speech: Cong on nepotism remark
97.article_body: Congress leader Kumari Selja on Monday took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi over his "nepotism" remark by saying that PM was doing politics instead of focusing on issues concerning common people. "Unemployment is hitting people hard and the government is tight-lipped about it instead of speaking about nepotism," said Congress leader Ambika Soni.

98.title: 40-yr-old property dealer shot dead while riding his bike in Delhi
98.article_body: A 40-year-old property dealer was shot dead by unknown two-wheeler-borne miscreants on Sunday in southeast Delhi’s Jamia Nagar, police said. The victim, identified as Mohammad Waseef Sattar Ghazi, was reportedly riding his bike when some unknown persons fired at him. "The doctors of the hospital declared him dead. Police immediately reached the hospital and initiated an enquiry," an official said.

99.title: Andhra student's mother scolds him for low attendance; he dies by suicide
99.article_body: A 16-year-old student in Andhra Pradesh's Vuyyuru town allegedly died by suicide after being disturbed over being scolded by his mother for bunking classes. The victim's mother, who works as a teacher in a private school, had scolded him after noticing that his class attendance was poor. Based on the mother's complaint, police have registered a case of suspicious death.

100.title: It's tough: Busta on comparison between 1st Masters 1000 title, Olympic bronze
100.article_body: On being asked if winning his first ATP Masters 1000 title in Montreal on Sunday was a bigger achievement than his Olympic bronze medal, world number 14 Pablo Carreño Busta said it's tough to compare. "Beating Novak Djokovic to win the bronze...was probably the most exciting moment of my career for sure...but I'm enjoying also both of them," he added.

101.title: Many thought India will be ruined if British left, but it thrived: PM
101.article_body: Many during the last stages of the freedom struggle said India will be "ruined" and go into the "dark age" if the British left, but the country developed, PM Narendra Modi said on Monday. The people proved India has immense capacity to survive all odds even as "hundreds of years of slavery" had inflicted "deep wounds" on it, he added.

102.title: Several people attend flower show themed on Puneeth Rajkumar in B'luru
102.article_body: A huge crowd of fans of late actor Puneeth Rajkumar visited Lal Bagh to pay their tributes to him on the last day of the flower show. Over 1.2 lakh people visited the flower show in the last week. The Bengaluru Traffic Police issued a traffic advisory to the people who are visiting the park on Independence Day.

103.title: Delhi airport launches DigiYatra app for faster e-boarding
103.article_body: The Delhi International Airport Limited on Monday announced the soft launch of the 'DigiYatra' application, which passengers can now use for faster e-boarding through the airport. The 'DigiYatra' is a Biometric Enabled Seamless Travel experience (BEST) based on Facial Recognition Technology. The passengers' faces would act as their documents, like ID proof, vaccine proof and a boarding pass.

104.title: Bruno Coutinho and IM Vijayan worthier of AIFF Prez post: Bhaichung
104.article_body: Former India captain Bhaichung Bhutia has said he feels ex-players Bruno Coutinho and IM Vijayan are far more worthy than himself of being the next AIFF President. Bhaichung said he wishes to wait for the final electoral list before commenting on the people vying for the post. He added that there have been informal discussions about him contesting as well.

105.title: Couple, their 3 children die while sleeping as wall collapses in Chhattisgarh
105.article_body: A couple and their three children were killed as a wall in their house collapsed in Chhattisgarh's Kanker district, officials said. The victims were asleep in their mudhouse when the incident took place. Officials added that the area was cut off from the road due to an overflowing rivulet but despite that an administrative team managed to reach there.

106.title: Man arrested in Manesar for murdering friend over business rivalry
106.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested in Haryana's Manesar for allegedly murdering his friend over a business rivalry. The accused, Manoj, used to work with the deceased, Pankaj (27), in the construction business before they parted their ways, police said. Notably, Pankaj was allegedly hit multiple times on his head with a stone and his body was found in Kasan village.

107.title: Police constable injured in Srinagar encounter succumbs to injuries
107.article_body: A police constable who was injured during an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Sunday succumbed to the injuries on Independence Day. The martyr has been identified as Constable Sarfaraz Ahmad, a resident of Batote area of Ramban district. Kashmir Zone Police said, "We pay rich tributes to the martyr for his supreme sacrifice made in line of duty."

108.title: Occultist accuses female helper of theft; owners strip, beat her in Delhi
108.article_body: A family in Delhi stripped their 43-year-old domestic help and assaulted her on suspicion of stealing from them after performing an occult ceremony. An occultist accused the victim of stealing from the family after a series of rituals, following which she was stripped naked, held captive in a room for almost 24 hours and assaulted, reports said.

109.title: Will provide aid to N Korea in exchange for denuclearisation: S Korea
109.article_body: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol on Monday offered economic aid to North Korea on condition that the latter abandons its nuclear weapons programme. "We'll implement a...[scheme] to provide food...transmission and distribution of electrical power and carry out projects to modernise ports...to facilitate trade," Yoon said. He made these remarks during a ceremony marking Korean Liberation Day.

110.title: UK becomes 1st country to approve booster vaccine that targets two COVID-19 variants
110.article_body: The UK has become the first country to approve a COVID-19 booster vaccine that targets two variants of the virus. The adapted COVID-19 vaccine made by Moderna targets the original virus from 2020 and the Omicron variant. The vaccine is authorised for use in people who are aged 18 or over.

111.title: Even 5 to 7-year-old children tell parents they don't want to play with foreign toys: PM
111.article_body: Talking about 'Atmanirbhar Bharat' during his Independence Day speech, PM Narendra Modi said, "I have heard from countless families that 5 to 7-year-old children tell their parents that they do not want to play with foreign toys." He added, "When a 5-year-old child makes such a resolution, it reflects the spirit of self-reliant India in him."

112.title: India-Bangladesh border force exchange sweets
112.article_body: On the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day, the Border Security Force (BSF) and Border Guards Bangladesh (BGB) shared sweets and greetings at the Indo-Bangladesh border in Fulbari, West Bengal. The border guarding forces of both the countries met in July and discussed reducing cross-border crimes and taking necessary steps to maintain peace and tranquillity along the border.

113.title: I'm trying to use pressure in my favour: Alcaraz ahead of Cincinnati Open
113.article_body: Ahead of his second round match at Cincinnati Open, world number four Carlos Alcaraz said he's learning to handle the pressure to be one of the favourites to win the tournament. "The kind of player I am means I am trying to use the pressure in my favour," he added. The 19-year-old lost in second round in Montreal last week.

114.title: We've to become self-reliant in energy sector: PM during I-Day speech
114.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, during his Independence Day address on Monday, said India has to become self-reliant in the energy sector. "How long will we be dependent on others in the field of energy? We should be self-reliant in the fields of solar energy, wind energy and various other renewable energy sources like Mission Hydrogen [and] biofuel," he added.

115.title: Take a pledge to make J&K corruption free: J&K L-G Sinha
115.article_body: J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha urged people to take an oath of making the Union Territory free of corruption and illegal drugs. He also declared that the valley will observe August 5 as "Freedom from Corruption" Day every year. “Let’s take a pledge to make J&K free of corruption and illegal drugs,” said Sinha.

116.title: 48-yr-old tea seller stores, sells Chinese manjha in Delhi, arrested
116.article_body: A 48-year-old shopkeeper was arrested for allegedly storing and selling the illegal 'Chinese manjha' in Delhi's Nihal Vihar area, police said on Monday. A total of 170 bundles of Chinese Manjha were recovered from the accused's shop, DCP (outer) Sameer Sharma said. The accused revealed that he was selling the illegal item to earn money, police said.

117.title: 1,108 new cases of COVID-19 logged in Bengaluru on Sunday
117.article_body: Bengaluru reported 1,108 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 6.58% on Sunday, as per data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's (BBMP) Chief Commissioner. No new deaths due to the infection were recorded. According to the data, 610 people recovered from the infection. The fresh cases and the recoveries took Bengaluru's active case count to 7,279.

118.title: Pune district to see rainfall till Aug 16, IMD sounds orange alert
118.article_body: With the Southwest monsoon currently active over Maharashtra and central India, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that Pune district will receive moderate to heavy showers till August 16. The weather agency added that the district will remain on orange alert till then. The IMD also placed Raigad, Ratnagiri and Satara districts on orange alert.

119.title: 18-yr-old Gauff becomes second-youngest doubles world no. 1 with Toronto title
119.article_body: US' 18-year-old Coco Gauff has become world number one in women's doubles after winning the doubles title with fellow American Jessie Pegula at National Bank Open in Toronto. Third seeds beat unseeded pair of Ellen Perez and Nicole Melichar-Martinez 6-4, 6-7(5-7), [10-5] in Sunday's final. Gauff is the second-youngest player in history, behind Martina Hingis, to become doubles number one.

120.title: Want to build a nation where women are safe: West Bengal CM
120.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Monday expressed her desire to build a nation where no one goes hungry and where women feel safe. "I want to build a nation where no one goes hungry, where no woman feels unsafe, where every child sees the light of education, where all are treated equally," she tweeted.

121.title: 'NTR31' to go on floors by April 2023, director Prashanth Neel confirms
121.article_body: Director Prashanth Neel has confirmed that his upcoming film with Jr NTR, tentatively titled 'NTR31', will go on the floors by April 2023. The 'KGF 2' director, who called himself a fan of NTR, said he had met the actor 10-15 times to "understand him a little more". However, he refused to share any other details about the film.

122.title: Prabhas' 'Salaar' to release on Sept 28, 2023; will compete with Hrithik's 'Fighter'
122.article_body: The makers of 'Salaar' have announced the release date of the Prabhas starrer. The Prashanth Neel directorial will release on September 28, 2023. The film will be competing at the box office with Hrithik Roshan and Deepika Padukone's 'Fighter', which is set to release on the same date. 'Fighter', directed by Siddharth Anand, marks Hrithik and Deepika's first film together.

123.title: Feel protective about you as much as my twins: Johar on Ayan's b'day
123.article_body: Director Karan Johar on Monday penned a birthday note for Ayan Mukerji in which he praised the director's hard work and commitment to his dream project, 'Brahmastra'. Johar said he feels protective of Ayan just like he does for his twins, Yash and Roohi. He said while no one can predict Brahmastra's box-office journey, Ayan is already a winner.

124.title: Attempts were made to forget Ambedkar, Lal Bahadur Shastri: K'taka CM
124.article_body: Amid controversy over excluding first PM Jawaharlal Nehru in the Karnataka government's newspaper advertisement on freedom fighters, CM Basavaraj Bommai said that attempts have been made to forget icons BR Ambedkar and Lal Bahadur Shastri. "If any Prime Minister had thought about making known the contributions of various PMs to the country, it is Narendra Modi," Bommai said.

125.title: UP CM Yogi Adityanath hoists national flag in Lucknow
125.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath hoisted the Tricolour in Lucknow on the occasion of the 76th Independence Day and appreciated PM Modi's call for 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' programme. "PM Modi has made the Amrit Mahotsav programme of independence a national festival by connecting it with the common man...Today’s occasion is extremely important for all of us," said the CM.

126.title: TN govt to use AI surveillance to prevent elephant deaths due to train accidents
126.article_body: Tamil Nadu's forest department is planning to set up an artificial intelligence (AI) system to prevent elephant deaths due to train-related incidents on tracks between Madukkarai and Walayar in Coimbatore. The 150-metre area around the tracks will be divided into red, orange and yellow zones. Concerned authorities will be automatically alerted if an elephant enters any of the zones.

127.title: Disgusting, fans need to show respect: Kyrgios on fans calling Medvedev 'loser'
127.article_body: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios has criticised fans after a video emerged on social media which shows a group of fans chanting "loser" towards world number one Daniil Medvedev. "Disgusting behaviour. This is the best we have in the sport, fans need to show some respect," tweeted Kyrgios. The incident happened after Medvedev lost to Kyrgios at the Canadian Open.

128.title: Centre begins process to auction additional 5,500 MHz of 5G spectrum
128.article_body: Department of Telecommunications (DoT) has started the process to auction off an additional 5,500 MHz of 5G spectrum after recently completing the sale of ₹1.5 lakh crore worth of airwaves. DoT has formed an internal committee to formulate a plan to include 37.0-42.5 GHz as international mobile telecommunications (IMT) bands. IMT is useful in offering 5G fixed wireless access services.

129.title: Zoom installer's macOS version can give attackers root access: Security expert
129.article_body: macOS version of Zoom installer can be used by attackers to gain root access to Mac, according to security specialist Patrick Wardle. Zoom's updater function installs update packages after checking if it has been cryptographically signed by Zoom. According to Wardle, attackers can substitute the update package with any malware program by keeping its name same as Zoom's signing certificate.

130.title: Tricolour hoisted at Bengaluru's Idgah Maidan for 1st time
130.article_body: On occasion of Independence Day, the Indian flag was hoisted at the Idgah Maidan in Bengaluru by revenue department officials on Monday morning amid tight security. This is the first time that the Indian flag was hoisted at the site. The flag hoisting was followed by the singing of the national anthem and the state anthem, reports said.

131.title: It's stupid to ignore 'Bazball': Sam Billings on Elgar's 'it has no longevity' comment
131.article_body: Responding to SA Test captain Dean Elgar's comment that England's 'Bazball' approach in Test cricket has no "longevity", England wicketkeeper-batter Sam Billings said, "You'd be pretty stupid to ignore that if I'm honest." Billings also referred to England Lions' win in the four-day practice match against South Africa and said it was a "wake-up call" for the Dean Elgar-led side.

132.title: French Prez Emmanuel Macron tweets in Hindi to wish Indians on Independence Day
132.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Monday tweeted in Hindi to wish Indians on 75 years of Independence. He wrote, "Dear friend Narendra Modi, dear people of India, congratulations on your Independence Day!" Macron added, "As you proudly celebrate India's stunning achievements in the past 75 years, you can count on France to always stand by your side."

133.title: Artistes make human image of India's map at Red Fort, PM Modi takes a walk; video viral
133.article_body: A video has gone viral showing young artistes forming a human image of the map of India at Red Fort during the Independence Day celebrations. In the video, PM Narendra Modi can be seen taking a walk and meeting the children and acknowledging their efforts. Another video showed PM Modi asking artistes from Punjab to do 'bhangra'.

134.title: Facebook missed Brazil polls-related misinformation in ads: Report
134.article_body: According to a report by London-based non-profit firm Global Witness, Facebook failed to detect election-related misinformation in ads ahead of the 2022 election in Brazil. The ads, which were approved by Facebook but never released, contained wrong election date and incorrect voting methods. In a statement, Meta said it has prepared extensively and launched tools to promote reliable information.

135.title: India rightfully enjoys high prestige globally: Putin on 76th I-Day
135.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday congratulated India on the occasion of its 76th Independence Day, stating that India "rightfully enjoys high prestige on the world stage". "India’s achievements in the economic, social and other fields are widely acknowledged...[India] plays an important role in resolving topical issues on the international agenda," Putin said in a message.

136.title: Congratulations to Indian people on 75 yrs of Independence: UK PM
136.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson tweeted in both Hindi and English as he congratulated Indian people on 75 years of Independence on Monday. He said that during his visit to Gujarat and New Delhi, he'd seen the "thriving Living Bridge" between UK and India. "I look forward to seeing these bonds go from strength to strength in...next 75 years," he added.

137.title: Central government is hurting federal values: Telangana CM KCR
137.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said that the present central government is hurting the federal values. "It is indulging in conspiracies that weaken the states financially as if cutting the branch on which one is seated," Rao added. The Union government which talks about the ideals of cooperative federalism is, in reality, indulging in the centralisation of powers, Rao added.

138.title: Philippines looks to buy US helicopters after scrapping Russia deal
138.article_body: The Philippines is in talks with the US to buy Chinook helicopters after scrapping a $227.35 million deal with Russia for 16 Mi-17 military helicopters, Manila's ambassador said. The ambassador said the decision has been taken to avoid sanctions from the west. The US is willing to strike a deal with the Philippines of the same amount including maintenance.

139.title: Bharat Biotech completes phase 3 trial of intranasal COVID vaccine
139.article_body: Bharat Biotech on Monday said it has completed clinical development for phase 3 trials and booster doses for the BBV154 (Covaxin) intranasal COVID-19 vaccine. Bharat Biotech International Limited announced that BBV154 has proven to be safe, well-tolerated and immunogenic in subjects in controlled clinical trials. It has been specifically formulated to allow intranasal delivery.

140.title: DMK's Dravidian model embodies Mahatma's ideals: TN CM on I-Day
140.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin in his Independence Day address at Fort St George in Chennai earlier today said that the DMK regime's Dravidian model embodies Mahatma Gandhi's ideals of secularism and brotherhood. "Mahatma Gandhi epitomised all lofty humanitarian principles...and he is among the great national symbols that should be reminded often to people," Stalin said after unfurling the tricolour.

141.title: Man falls to death from terrace while raising flag in Bengaluru
141.article_body: A 33-year-old software engineer died on Sunday after falling from a second-floor terrace while trying to raise the national flag in Bengaluru's Hennur area, as per media reports. The man, identified as Vishwas Kumar, reportedly climbed the terrace wall to raise the flag at his home but slipped from there. Kumar is survived by his wife and a two-year-old daughter.

142.title: India hands over Dornier surveillance aircraft to Sri Lanka Navy
142.article_body: Indian High Commissioner in Colombo Gopal Baglay along with Vice Chief of Indian Navy Vice Admiral SN Ghormade handed over a Dornier maritime surveillance aircraft to the Sri Lanka Navy in Katunayake on Monday. This comes as India celebrates its 76th Independence Day. "Security of India and Sri Lanka is enhanced by mutual understanding, mutual trust and cooperation," Baglay said.

143.title: Morrison took on secret ministerial roles during COVID: Australian PM
143.article_body: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese sought legal advice after reports emerged that his predecessor Scott Morrison was secretly appointed to key ministerial roles, duplicating some portfolios during the pandemic. The Governor-General's office told Reuters that the appointments were valid under the constitution. However, Albanese accused Morrison of centralising power.

144.title: Freedom doesn't come without price: Urvashi Rautela on Independence Day
144.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela, speaking on the occasion of Independence Day, has said, "A big salute to all the soldiers who sacrificed their lives for our independence!" The actress further said that people should not let anything divide the idea of India. "Freedom does not come without a price, and neither did ours," she added.

145.title: Trial for drone-based healthcare services launched in Arunachal
145.article_body: A trial to use drones to provide healthcare services to tribal and rural communities in an Arunachal Pradesh town was launched on Monday. According to a press release, the healthcare drone pilots are a result of the state's partnership with the World Economic Forum's 'Medicine from the Sky' (MFTS) initiative. The drone network will serve the people of East Kameng.

146.title: 6 ancient wells restored at Hyderabad's Qutub Shahi Tombs
146.article_body: The Aga Khan Trust for Culture restored six historical wells situated at Golconda's Qutub Shahi Tombs compound to its past glory, Special Chief Secretary of Urban Administration Arvind Kumar said. The wells were in an extremely dilapidated condition and had turned almost into water puddle. After restoration, there is a total of 19.3 million litres of water in these wells.

147.title: Owaisi brothers hoist national flag in Hyderabad
147.article_body: AIMIM leaders Asaduddin Owaisi and Akbaruddin Owaisi hoisted the national flag in Hyderabad on the occasion of country's 76th Independence Day. The Tricolour was hoisted at Madina Circle near Charminar. "Our ancestors fought against British but they also fought for an India that was free from hunger, exploitation and tyranny. We must take their struggle forward," the Hyderabad MP said.

148.title: Iran reacts to attack on Rushdie, says he 'crossed red lines of 1.5 billion Muslims'
148.article_body: Iran's foreign ministry on Monday said no one has the right to level accusations against Iran over the attack on Salman Rushdie. "We do not consider anyone other than himself and his supporters worthy of...reproach and condemnation," Iran said. Rushdie "exposed himself to popular outrage by insulting Islamic sanctities and crossing the red lines of 1.5 billion Muslims," Iran added.

149.title: Traffic to stop in Hyd for mass singing of national anthem on Aug 16
149.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police on Sunday announced that traffic will come to a halt at all signalised and manned traffic junctions across the city for the mass singing of national anthem on August 16. All traffic signals will turn red at 11:30 am on Tuesday, police said. Police further urged commuters to stand and sing the national anthem at the junctions.

150.title: Man detained after Mukesh Ambani and his family receive death threats: Police
150.article_body: A suspect has been detained in Dahisar for issuing death threats to Reliance Industries' Chairman Mukesh Ambani and his family, Mumbai Police said. The man, who was identified as Afzal, allegedly made several threat calls on the display number of the Reliance Foundation Hospital on Monday morning. A case was registered after the hospital filed a complaint about the calls.

151.title: Haryana govt forms Municipal Council of Pataudi-Mandi
151.article_body: The municipalities of Pataudi and Haileymandi in Haryana have been merged and will now be operational as the Municipal Council of Pataudi-Mandi. Apart from having 10 adjoining villages, including Nerhera, Janola, Mirzapur and Mubarkpur, the newly-formed council is likely to have 32-35 wards. Notably, Haileymandi was named after an English governor named Malcolm Hailey.

152.title: Man claiming to be from Syria cheats Mumbai woman of ₹15 lakh
152.article_body: A 24-year-old technician from Mumbai lost ₹15 lakh in a 'customs clearance' fraud for claiming gifts sent by a man who claimed to be from Syria, police said on Sunday. The accused contacted the woman on Instagram and told her he would send his savings to her, for which she would need to pay customs charges, a police official said.

153.title: PM Modi let nation down by not discussing unfulfilled promises: Pawan Khera
153.article_body: Congress’ Pawan Khera said PM Narendra Modi has let the country down by not discussing the promises made by him in the last eight years and by not giving an account of his tenure. Khera's statement came following PM's Independence Day address. "His words sound tiring...his own words on promises made are troubling him now," Khera added.

154.title: Youth from tier-2, tier-3 cities behind success of startups: PM
154.article_body: During his ninth successive Independence Day speech, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that the success of digital and startup developments has been made possible by the youth of India's tier-2 and tier-3 cities. PM Modi mentioned that the country is moving towards 5G era. He also called India an aspirational society which is the biggest asset for any nation.

155.title: Man slits 22-yr-old pregnant girlfriend's throat over dispute in Thane
155.article_body: A 23-year-old man was arrested for allegedly slitting the throat of his 22-year-old pregnant girlfriend in Thane. During the investigation, it was found that the two had some issues arising from their relationship, said API Krupali Borse of the Mumbra police station. The accused wanted to get rid of the victim and killed her by slitting her throat, Borse said.

156.title: Israeli forces kill Palestinian man who tried to stab officers
156.article_body: Israeli police have said that security forces shot dead a Palestinian man who tried to stab officers during a raid in the occupied West Bank on Monday. The officers were conducting a raid at a house, police added. The deceased man's father claimed that his son wasn't armed and that the Israeli officers "immediately began shooting" on entering the house.

157.title: Stop reckless driving, illegal parking: Pune Traffic Police to PMPML
157.article_body: The Pune Traffic Police have written to the Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) to instruct their drivers to stop reckless driving at the Katraj chowk, adding that the drivers shouldn't illegally park their vehicles. "Action should be taken involved in rash driving. At Katraj stand, the drivers do not wait for passengers to board the bus," a commuter said.

158.title: US man drives vehicle through crowd leaving 1 dead, later kills mother
158.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly drove a vehicle through a crowd at a fundraiser event in Columbia County in US' Pennsylvania, then went home and killed his mother, police said. One person was killed and 17 others were injured in the incident at the fundraiser event, police added. The fundraiser was for victims of a house fire.

159.title: Stoinis accuses Pak bowler Hasnain of chucking, sparks controversy after video goes viral
159.article_body: Southern Brave's Australian all-rounder Marcus Stoinis accused Oval Invincibles' Pakistani pacer Muhammad Hasnain of chucking after the latter dismissed him. A video went viral showing Stoinis implying the 22-year-old's bowling action was illegal by miming a chucking motion. "Downright disgusting," a user tweeted. "How about sticking to playing...and letting officials do their job," wrote another.

160.title: Happy Independence Day to my fellow Indians all over the world: Preity
160.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta took to Instagram and wished her fans on the occasion of Independence Day. Preity shared pictures of herself and her twin babies with the national flag. Along with the pictures, she wrote, "Happy Independence Day to my fellow Indians all over the world from the three of us." Preity welcomed the twins in November 2021 through surrogacy.

161.title: Sonali Bendre celebrates Independence Day in Atlanta, shares pics
161.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre took to Instagram and shared pictures of her celebrations of India's Independence Day in Atlanta, United States. Along with the pictures, Sonali wrote, "Took a little bit of home to Atlanta." In the pictures, the actress can be seen waving the Indian national flag with several other Indians. Sonali recently featured in the OTT series 'Broken News'.

162.title: Indian fans love cricket: Mandhana on 'Women's IPL is coming' question
162.article_body: India Women batter Smriti Mandhana, who's currently playing in The Hundred women's tournament, was asked, "With the Women's IPL coming next year, can we expect the same kind of enthusiasm back in India as well?" Mandhana replied, "Indian fans love cricket and they turn up to support us regardless of whether it is a one-day or T20."

163.title: Not fair if we play 6 Tests in a year and India, Aus, Eng play 15: Anrich Nortje
163.article_body: South Africa pacer Anrich Nortje has said it's not fair that India, England and Australia are playing more Tests than them. "If we play six in a year and [they] play 15 in a year, I don't see that being fair. Our guys are not going to be as well-known...if we play 18 games in three years," he stated.

164.title: Gangster with ₹50,000 bounty arrested after shootout in Delhi
164.article_body: A 48-year-old gangster was arrested on Sunday following a brief shootout in southwest Delhi's Ghitorni village, officials said. The gangster, identified as Parveen Yadav, had a bounty of ₹50,000 over a case of shootout-cum-murder of a law student in Rohini in 2021, police said. Yadav was wanted in nearly 20 crime cases, including cases of extortion and assault, police added.

165.title: CM Bhagwant Mann announces setting up of 75 Aam Aadmi clinics in Punjab
165.article_body: On occasion of Independence Day, Punjab chief minister Bhagwant Mann has announced the setting up of 75 Aam Aadmi clinics in the state. The Chief Minister also praised youths from the state serving in Indian Army and said, "Every village of Punjab has...a memorial of martyrs who had fought for independence...Punjabi youths serving the Indian army are protecting the borders."

166.title: Pune woman completes 430-km-long 'Freedom Run' from Leh to Manali
166.article_body: Pune resident Preeti Maske has completed a 430-km-long 'Freedom Run' from Leh to Manali in a little over 118 hours, Border Roads Organisation (BRO) said in a tweet on Monday. "Daunting was the challenge, determined was Preeti," BRO's tweet further said. Maske had earlier set a Guinness World Record in June by cycling alone from Leh to Manali.

167.title: I-Day celebrations affect traffic movement on several roads in Delhi
167.article_body: The Independence Day celebrations led to vehicular traffic on several roads in Delhi on Monday. All Delhi borders have been closed due to security reasons, following which heavy traffic was reported on the DND flyover, Barapullah, Tikri border, Jharoda and Apsara Road. An additional police force was deployed in New Delhi, North Delhi and at the borders.

168.title: CR to add 10 additional AC local services in Mumbai division
168.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) will soon be adding 10 more air-conditioned (AC) local trains in Mumbai division, CPRO of CR said. Currently, there are 56 AC local services, with the 10 additional, total number of services will be 66. "The AC local is gaining popularity and it's evident by the sale of daily tickets," a CR official said.

169.title: What is DigiYatra app, the contactless passenger processing system for airports?
169.article_body: The Delhi International Airport Limited launched a beta version of the DigiYatra app, a passenger processing system based on facial recognition technology, at Terminal 3. After users download the app, they can pass through the airport's various checkpoints with paperless and contactless processing while their facial features will establish their identities, linking them to their boarding passes.

170.title: Thousands laid down their lives so India breathes this day: Sreejesh on I-Day
170.article_body: Indian men's hockey team goalkeeper PR Sreejesh took to Twitter on the occasion of 76th Independence Day and wrote, "Thousands laid down their lives so that our country breathes this day. Never forget their sacrifice." Commonwealth Games 2022 para table tennis gold medallist Bhavina Patel tweeted, "May our Tiranga always fly the highest. Wishing everyone a Happy Independence Day."

171.title: Won't make a comment on these things: Rahul on PM's nepotism remark
171.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi reacted to the 'Parivaarvaad' remark made by PM Narendra Modi in his Independence Day speech on Monday. "I won't make a comment on these things. Happy Independence to everyone," he said. PM Modi had said that two big challenges we face today are corruption and 'Parivaarvaad' or nepotism.

172.title: Man hides gold worth ₹13 lakh in underwear, caught at Hyd airport
172.article_body: Customs officials seized four gold bars, weighing 258.29 grams valued at ₹13,63,771, from a passenger who arrived at the Hyderabad airport from Dammam on Sunday morning. The passenger was trying to smuggle the gold bars by concealing them in a customised brief. Another passenger was arrested for trying to smuggle 154 grams of gold.

173.title: Holland takes break from social media, says 'I find it overstimulating'
173.article_body: 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' actor Tom Holland took to Instagram to announce a break from social media platforms. "I find Instagram and Twitter to be overstimulating, to be overwhelming," Holland said in the video. "I get caught up and I spiral when I read things about me online and ultimately it's very detrimental to my mental state," he added.

174.title: Tricolour will fly high when every Indian has access to good healthcare: Kejriwal
174.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said education and health are key to becoming a rich country.
