"Tricolour will fly high only when every Indian has access to good healthcare," Kejriwal added. Furthermore, he said, "A poor man's child can dream of becoming lawyer, engineer in Delhi because of education revolution here."

175.title: My grandparents would tell me horrifying stories of partition: Asees
175.article_body: Singer Asees Kaur has said that she was "really lucky" that she was born in free India. "My grandparents would tell us horrifying tales of Partition. I know their stories, struggles and all the hardships that they have gone through," she further added. Asees revealed she began singing when she was a five-year-old and added she sang all patriotic songs.

176.title: Taliban declares national holiday to mark 1 yr since return to power
176.article_body: Taliban has declared a national holiday on Monday to mark the first anniversary of its return to power in Afghanistan. "We fulfilled...obligation of jihad and liberated our country," a fighter who'd stormed Kabul during Taliban's takeover said. Thousands of people had rushed to Kabul airport as they tried to escape from Afghanistan after the Taliban's takeover on August 15, 2021.

177.title: Dropping Nehru's image in govt ad deliberate: Karnataka BJP leader
177.article_body: Karnataka BJP General Secretary and MLC Ravikumar on Monday said dropping Jawaharlal Nehru's image from the government advertisement for the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign was a "deliberate" act. "[Mahatma] Gandhiji had said that Congress should be dissolved after independence. However, Nehru didn't dissolve Congress. Due to all these reasons, we have dropped his picture from the ad," Ravikumar said.

178.title: Faridabad Police arrest 3 men for cheating people online
178.article_body: Three men were arrested by Faridabad Police for allegedly cheating people online. The suspects, Akshay, Darshan Bhai, and Sagar, assured high returns to the victims on conducting online business from home, police said. Notably, police have found transactions worth ₹47 crore in their bank accounts and recovered ₹1.20 lakh cash, one mobile phone, and one ATM card from their possession.

179.title: China conducts more drills near Taiwan amid US lawmakers' visit
179.article_body: Chinese military said they carried out more military drills near Taiwan on Monday. The step comes at a time when a group of US lawmakers visited Taiwan and met President Tsai Ing-wen. The People's Liberation Army's Eastern Theatre Command said the exercises were a stern deterrent to the US and Taiwan who continue to play political tricks.

180.title: After breaking up with Shakira, Gerard Pique dating 23-year-old PR student: Reports
180.article_body: After breaking up with singer Shakira, Barcelona footballer Gerard Pique is dating a 23-year-old PR student named Clara Chia Marti, as per reports. “Gerard and Clara have been seeing each other for months. She is a student who also works for him in his office, organising events," a source said. Pique and Shakira had announced their break-up in June.

181.title: Martin Guptill breaks Rohit Sharma's world record for scoring most runs in T20I cricket
181.article_body: New Zealand opener Martin Guptill has broken Team India captain Rohit Sharma's world record for scoring most runs in T20I cricket. With his 15-run knock in the third T20I against West Indies, Guptill took his tally of runs in T20I cricket to 3,497, overtaking Rohit, who has scored 3,487 runs. Virat Kohli is third on the list, with 3,308 runs.

182.title: PayNearby launches 'zero investment plan' for rural women
182.article_body: Fintech startup PayNearby launched a 'zero investment plan' for women entrepreneurs across 20,000+ pin codes. To help rural women achieve financial independence, under this initiative, the firm will waive off opening fees for business account, which are otherwise charged at ₹1,000. Women partners, however, will be required to pay a bare minimum cost for the KYC completion.

183.title: PMC to construct 150 mobile immersion tanks for Ganesh Chaturthi
183.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has commenced preparations along with its Solid Waste Management Department to build 150 mobile immersion tanks for Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations this year. Along with these tanks, PMC will also construct over 130 fixed tanks for the idols' immersion across the city. The expenses for the fixed tanks have been approved, the civic body confirmed.

184.title: Rushdie's son releases statement, says his sense of humour remains intact after attack
184.article_body: Salman Rushdie's son Zafar has released his family's statement on his father's condition after the author was stabbed multiple times on Friday in New York. Zafar said his father remains in critical condition, adding, "Though his life-changing injuries are severe, his usual feisty and defiant sense of humour remains intact." Zafar thanked audience members who helped Rushdie after the attack.

185.title: President Droupadi Murmu pays tribute at National War Memorial in Delhi
185.article_body: On occasion of Independence Day, President Droupadi Murmu paid tribute at National War Memorial in Delhi on Monday. News agency ANI reported that Army chief, General Manoj Pande, Indian Navy chief, Admiral R Hari Kumar and Indian Air Force chief, Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari were also present. Pictures were shared on the official Twitter handle of President of India.

186.title: BJP will say we are distributing freebies: Tejashwi on Nitish's jobs announcement
186.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav reacted to CM Nitish Kumar's announcement of 10 lakh jobs and 10 lakh additional employment opportunities and said that BJP will now say that we are distributing freebies. "I was saying from the beginning that we, and not BJP, will fulfil the promise...It's an achievement that today discussions are being held on employment," he added.

187.title: Catastrophe: German minister on mass die-off of fish in Oder river
187.article_body: German Environment Minister Steffi Lemke on Sunday called the mass die-off of fish in Oder river, which runs through Germany and Poland, an "ecological disaster". Lemke was addressing a press conference along with her Polish counterpart Anna Moskwa. Moskwa said that Oder river samples will be tested for about 300 potential substances and will also be sent to foreign laboratories.

188.title: I didn't expect it could happen again: Nadal on chance to become world no. 1
188.article_body: World number three Rafael Nadal has said he didn't expect that he could again have the chance to become the world number one men's singles player. Nadal could become the top-ranked player if he wins the Cincinnati Open and Daniil Medvedev faces an early exit. "It means a lot to me to have [this] opportunity," added Nadal.

189.title: Maharashtra CM hoists Tricolour on 76th Independence Day
189.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde hoisted the Tricolour at the state secretariat on the country's 76th Independence Day. CM Shinde said that his government is committed to extend the reservation benefits to Other Backward Classes, Maratha and Dhangar communities. "We started working from day one and our priority is to work for the common man, farmers," he added.

190.title: Transparent selection without nepotism got India medals: PM Modi on CWG 2022
190.article_body: While addressing the nation on the occasion of 76th Independence Day, PM Narendra Modi stated that it is his constitutional duty to fight nepotism. Referring to the CWG 2022, he stated, "We saw in the recently concluded sports event we did well. It’s not that we didn’t have talent earlier...but transparent selection bereft of nepotism led to India scoring medals."

191.title: Will oppose misrepresentation of historical facts: Sonia Gandhi
191.article_body: While addressing the nation on the 76th Independence Day, Congress president Sonia Gandhi criticised the Centre and said the government is hell-bent on trivialising sacrifices of freedom fighters and their glorious achievements. “Congress will strongly oppose misrepresentation of historical facts for political gains and every attempt to put national leaders in the dock,” said Sonia.

192.title: Priyanka Gandhi, Rahul take part in Cong’s 'Azadi Gaurav Yatra' in Delhi
192.article_body: Congress leaders Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and Rahul Gandhi on Monday took part in party's 'Azadi Gaurav Yatra' in Delhi on Independence Day. Party leaders Anand Sharma and Ghulam Nabi Azad also took part in the Yatra. "We should remember our martyrs, citizens and leaders who sacrificed their lives for independence and due to whom we are independent today," Priyanka said.

193.title: PM's 'bhai-batijawad' comment was likely on his own party: Congress
193.article_body: Congress reacted to PM Narendra Modi's 'bhai-batijawad' comment during his Independence Day address and said that it is likely an internal issue of the BJP. "Only PM Modi can clarify whether his attack was on his own ministers or their sons...But the country expected him to submit a report card of the last eight years," Congress' Pawan Khera said.

194.title: Domino's India responds after pics of mops hanging above pizza dough go viral
194.article_body: Domino's India responded after purported pictures of cleaning mops and a toilet brush hanging above trays of pizza dough at its outlet in Bengaluru went viral on Twitter. Domino's said that it has zero tolerance for violations of hygiene and food safety standards. "The incident...will be thoroughly investigated and basis the findings, appropriate measures will be rolled out," it added.

195.title: Indian-origin astronaut shares pics of Hyderabad from space, Tricolour at space station
195.article_body: On the occasion of Independence Day, Indian-American astronaut Raja Chari shared pictures of the Tricolour at International Space Station and view of Hyderabad from space. "I'm reminded of Indian diaspora that I could see from [space station] where my immigrant father's home town of Hyderabad shines bright. [NASA] is just 1 place Indian-Americans make a difference every day," he tweeted.

196.title: Virat, Anushka join 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign, pose with Tricolour at Mumbai home
196.article_body: Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli wished the people on the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day and displayed the Tricolour at their residence in Mumbai, joining Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. "Celebrating 75 years of our Independence. Wishing all the Indians around the world a very Happy Independence Day. Jai Hind," Anushka wrote on Instagram.

197.title: Bihar CM announces 10 lakh jobs, 10 lakh additional employment opportunities on I-Day
197.article_body:
On the occasion of Independence Day, Bihar Chief Minister announced arrangement of 10 lakh jobs and 10 lakh additional employment opportunities in the state. Taking to Twitter, Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav wrote, "Many thanks to respected Chief Minister Shri @NitishKumar
 ji for the historic announcement of arranging 10 lakh jobs and other 10 lakh [additional] jobs in Bihar."

198.title: 80 children die from measles amid outbreak in Zimbabwe: Report
198.article_body: Zimbabwe's health ministry has said that 80 children have died following a measles outbreak since April, which has now spread nationwide with a case fatality rate of 6.9%, according to a statement seen by Reuters. "[Church gatherings] which were attended by people from different provinces...with unknown vaccination status led to...spread of measles," the ministry's secretary said in a statement.

199.title: Man with knife can't silence man with pen: NY Guv on attack on Rushdie
199.article_body: New York State Governor Kathy Hochul has condemned the attack on author Salman Rushdie, saying, "A man with a knife can't silence a man with a pen." Hochul made the remark during an address at Chautauqua Institution, where the attack took place. "New York State will always stand up to protect freedom of expression [and] freedom of speech," she added.

200.title: I'll remember this for life: Raducanu on facing Serena Williams at Cincinnati Open
200.article_body: The reigning US Open champion Emma Raducanu has said she's excited to play against Serena Williams for the first time in their first-round match at the Cincinnati Open. "It'll be an incredible experience...I'll surely remember [it] the rest of my life," said the 19-year-old. Williams will be playing her last WTA tournament before her retirement at the US Open.

201.title: Mukesh Ambani and his family receive threat calls, Mumbai Police begin probe
201.article_body: A complaint has been filed by the Reliance Foundation Hospital about receiving calls posing threat to Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani and his family, ANI reported quoting Mumbai Police on Monday. As many as eight calls were received at the hospital, as per reports. Mumbai Police said that a case is being filed in this matter and investigation is underway.

202.title: Woman's 'You're a bomber' text to boyfriend leads to 6-hour delay in Mumbai flight
202.article_body: An IndiGo flight travelling from Mangaluru to Mumbai was delayed by six hours after a woman passenger alerted the cabin crew about a suspicious text message on a fellow traveller’s phone. The man was reportedly texting his girlfriend, who wrote to him 'You are a bomber'. The police later confirmed that it was a friendly chat between both of them.

203.title: Mukesh Ambani celebrates Independence Day with wife Nita, grandson Prithvi
203.article_body: A video showing Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani celebrating Independence Day with wife Nita Ambani and grandson Prithvi Ambani has surfaced online. The video shows AR Rahman's 'Maa Tujhe Salaam' playing in the background with several people holding the National Flags. His house Antilia was also lit up in Tricolour.

204.title: Mumbai banker wanting to get Fastag recharge loses ₹7 lakh in cyber-fraud
204.article_body: A 34-year-old Mumbai-based bank manager, who wanted to get her Fastag recharged, lost ₹7 lakh to cyber-fraudsters after calling a Fastag helpline number she found on internet. As per the complainant, the fraudsters took her vehicle details and sent a link to her. After clicking on the link, the victim logged into her bank's app and the money got deducted.

205.title: They call him 'Badshah of BSE', but he was a dreamer: Irani on Jhunjhunwala
205.article_body: Condoling the demise of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, Union Minister Smriti Irani tweeted, "They call him a billionaire investor, the badshah of BSE...but what he really was...is and always will be...is a dreamer." In another tweet, Irani wrote, "Bhaiyya always told me 'apan apne dam par jeeyenge' (we will live on our own terms)...And he lived on his own terms."

206.title: BSF, Pakistan Rangers exchange sweets at Int’l Border in J&K on India’s I-Day
206.article_body: On the occasion of India’s 76th Independence Day, sweets were exchanged between the Border Security Force (BSF) troops and Pakistan Rangers at the International Border in Jammu and Kashmir’s RS Pura. "BSF has always been on the forefront in creating a peaceful and congenial atmosphere on border while dominating the border effectively," BSF said.

207.title: Let's take vow not to forget history: Kamal Haasan on Independence Day
207.article_body: Taking to Twitter, Kamal Haasan wished his fans on the occasion of Independence Day. "If you forget history, you'll have to return to the...same old days says history. Let us take a vow not to forget history," Kamal wrote in Tamil. He urged people to recall freedom fighters and Indian armed forces that enabled them to celebrate Independence Day.

208.title: Assam govt to withdraw 1 lakh minor cases to reduce burden on lower judiciary: CM
208.article_body: Assam government will withdraw one lakh minor cases, including those for social media posts to help reduce the burden on lower judiciary, state Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said. The announcement came during Independence Day celebrations in Guwahati. He said that the government has decided that minor cases registered before midnight of August 14, 2021, will be withdrawn.

209.title: Indian Navy hoist Tricolour across 6 continents, 3 oceans & 6 time zones; video surfaces
209.article_body: As part of the celebrations on 75 years of Independence, the Indian Navy have deployed warships to every continent except Antarctica. The Indian Navy warships hoisted the Tricolour across six continents, three oceans and six different time zones. The warships were deployed in Perth, Singapore, Muscat, Mombasa, London, Rio de Janeiro and San Diego.

210.title: 'Laal...' gives message of maintaining mutual brotherhood: Punjab CM Mann
210.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann took to Twitter and praised Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Today, I got a chance to watch 'Laal Singh Chaddha'...the movie gives a message of maintaining mutual brotherhood...not letting the seeds of hatred grow in tender hearts," he tweeted. Mann further congratulated Aamir and his team. Mann's tweet comes amid the boycott calls against the film.

211.title: B'luru buildings light up with tri-coloured lights on I-Day, pics surface
211.article_body: On the occasion of Independence Day, several buildings in Bengaluru lit up in tri-coloured lights. Bengaluru MP PC Mohan shared picture of illuminated Vidhan Soudha. Meanwhile, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya shared video of NIMHANS Bengaluru "proudly lit with Tricolour glory". Pictures of Munireddypalya TV Tower and Sir M Visvesvaraya Baiyyappanahalli Railway terminal were also shared.

212.title: Bill Gates tweets on India's I-Day, praises PM Modi for prioritising healthcare
212.article_body:
The world’s fifth richest man and Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates tweeted wishes on India's 76th Independence Day. He tweeted, "As India celebrates its Independence Day, I congratulate 
Narendra Modi for prioritising healthcare and digital transformation while spearheading India's development. India's progress in these sectors is inspiring and we are fortunate to partner in this journey."

213.title: Were told not to go to police, teacher paid ₹1.5 lakh: Raj dalit boy's uncle
213.article_body: Uncle of nine-year-old dalit boy, who died after he was beaten up by his school teacher for drinking water from the pot, said that the Rajputs told the family to reach a compromise and not go to the police. "The teacher gave us ₹1.5 lakh...in two instalments and said...he was ready to pay another lakh for...Indra's treatment," the uncle said.

214.title: 300 firefighters battle forest fire in Spain; 1,500 evacuated
214.article_body: About 1,500 people were evacuated on Sunday due to a raging forest fire in Spain's Zaragoza province as 300 firefighters battled the blaze. The regional head said that the forest fire had spread rapidly due to high winds and that the situation was "critical". The blaze had spread over a 50 km area within 24 hours, a forest chief said.

215.title: PM Modi releases pics of Independence Day celebration at Red Fort today
215.article_body: PM Narendra Modi shared pictures of the Independence Day celebration held at the Red Fort on Monday. PM Modi addressed the nation from the monument after hoisting the Tricolour and listed five resolves for the citizens for the next 25 years. The resolves include developing India, removing every ounce of slavery, pride for our glorious heritage, unity and fulfilling duties.

216.title: Infosys is in stable position because of its founders: CEO Parekh
216.article_body: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh praised the company's founding members for building an "incredible organisation" and voiced confidence that the firm will continue to be stable. In an interview with PTI, Parekh said he believes that Infosys is "well-positioned" to leverage tech-led growth opportunities over the next several years. Infosys raised full-year revenue growth outlook to 14-16% for FY23.

217.title: Aug 5 to be celebrated as 'Freedom from Corruption' day every year in J&K: Sinha
217.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha said the administration has decided that August 5 will be celebrated as "Freedom from Corruption" day every year. "Continuous drives against corruption will be done throughout the year," Sinha added. He took part in Independence Day celebrations in Srinagar on Monday. "In new J&K, ground of 21st century for realising dreams...of youth...being prepared," Sinha added.

218.title: CM Bommai participates in midnight flag hoisting event in Bengaluru
218.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai took part in midnight flag hoisting and cultural program organised as part of 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' to mark 75th anniversary of India's independence at Bengaluru's Malleswaram Barangay. "PM Narendra Modi's 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign received an amazing response. We saw record participation from people across different walks of life," he said at the event.

219.title: Video of Spurs manager Conte, Chelsea boss Tuchel's heated argument viral
219.article_body: A video of Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte and Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel's heated argument after their sides played out a 2-2 draw has gone viral. When both managers came face to face after the match, they had to be separated by players. Conte and Tuchel had also confronted each other when Spurs had equalised the scoreline to 1-1.

220.title: Self-obsessed govt adamant to trivialise freedom fighters' sacrifices: Sonia Gandhi
220.article_body: On the occasion of Independence Day, Congress chief Sonia Gandhi said today's "self-obsessed government" is adamant about "trivialising" sacrifices of freedom fighters and achievements of the country. "Congress will oppose wrong statements made on historical facts for political benefits...every attempt to question...national leaders like Gandhi, Nehru, Patel and Azad on basis of lies," she added.

221.title: PM Modi uses paper notes not teleprompter for his 82-min I-Day speech
221.article_body: PM Narendra Modi used paper notes and not a teleprompter, in his address to the nation on the occasion of 76th Independence Day. His speech lasted about 82 minutes and this marked his ninth address from the Red Fort. Among other things, PM Modi laid out a development strategy for India for the next 25 years in his speech.

222.title: 50th anniversary of independence wasn't packaged like this: Himachal CM
222.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur praised the 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' initiative of his party to mark 75 years of India's independence and said, this is how Prime Minister Narendra Modi operates. Criticising the Congress government, he said, "The fiftieth year of independence had just passed us by like a routine (event). It wasn't packaged like this big event."

223.title: India's achievements in combating COVID-19 better than developed countries: Prez
223.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu said India's achievements in combating COVID-19 pandemic have been better than those of many developed countries. "For this feat, we're grateful to our scientists, doctors...paramedics...staff associated with vaccination," she added. The government and policymakers deserve credit for "beating global trend and helping economy flourish" despite COVID-19 pandemic, she stated.

224.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh hoists national flag in Delhi
224.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh hoisted the tricolour at his residence in Delhi. Singh tweeted, “Unfurled the National Flag at my residence on the 75th anniversary of India’s Independence.” Singh asserted on Saturday that the government has put in place a flawless security system to ensure that no anti-India element can cast an evil eye on the sovereignty of the country.

225.title: Kerala Congress criticises PM Modi over ‘Parivarvaad’ remark
225.article_body: Kerala Congress criticised PM Modi for his remark on nepotism during his Independence Day speech. The party said, "We need to free the country from sangh parivarvaad. There's a real need to raise awareness against these corrupt termites in power who eat and sell whatever we've built as a country in the last 75 years!"

226.title: PM Modi pays tribute to Mahatma Gandhi at Rajghat
226.article_body: PM Modi paid tribute to Mahatma Gandhi at Rajghat on the country’s 76th Independence Day. He also greeted people on the occasion. “Greetings on this very special Independence Day,” PM Modi said. The August 15 ceremony is significant this year as it marks the 75th anniversary of India's independence, with the government launching a host of exercises and programmes.

227.title: S Korean Prez calls for improved ties with Japan, peace with N Korea
227.article_body: South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol said South Korea must overcome historical disputes with Japan and achieve peace with North Korea to bolster stability. Yoon made the statement during a ceremony which marked Korean Liberation Day. The relations between South Korea and Japan strained over Korean accusations of wartime abuse like Japan forcing women to work in brothels for its military.

228.title: Necessary to add 'Jai Anusandhan' to 'Jai Jawan, Jai Kisan, Jai Vigyaan': PM
228.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said there is necessity to make addition to 'Jai Jawan, Jai Kisan, Jai Vigyaan' slogan. "We...remember Lal Bahadur Shastri ji's slogan of 'Jai Jawan, Jai Kisan'...Later, AB Vajpayee added 'Jai Vigyaan' to this slogan. Now, there is...necessity to add - 'Jai Anusandhan' (research & innovation). Jai Jawan, Jai Kisan, Jai Vigyaan aur Jai Anusandhan," he added.

229.title: BJP chief JP Nadda greets people on Independence Day
229.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda extended his wishes to all the countrymen on the country’s 76th Independence Day. He paid tributes to freedom fighters who sacrificed their lives. “Happy Independence Day to all. Tribute to the great revolutionaries and freedom fighters who dedicated their lives for the freedom of Mother Bharati. This country will always be indebted to you,” tweeted Nadda.

230.title: Taliban must allow girls to go to school: Former Afghan Prez Karzai
230.article_body: In an interview with DW News, former Afghanistan President Hamid Karzai said Taliban must allow girls to go to school and Afghan women will be educated to become engineers, doctors, journalists and parliamentarians. "There's no compromise, no way we will allow Afghan girls being denied education," Karzai added. Karzai called the manner of the US troop withdrawal from Afghanistan disgraceful.

231.title: Putin writes to Kim Jong-un, says Russia & North Korea will expand relations: Reports
231.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin wrote to North Korea's Kim Jong-un on liberation day of Korea and said the two countries will "expand the comprehensive and constructive bilateral relations with common efforts", North Korean state media reported. Putin said closer ties would be in both countries' interests and would help strengthen the security and stability of the Korean peninsula, it added.

232.title: Let us make India the strongest, most prosperous: Harbhajan, Hardik on I-Day
232.article_body: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya and former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to share their wishes on the occasion of Independence Day. Hardik shared pictures holding the National Flag and wrote, "To all my fellow Indians, happy Independence Day." Harbhajan said, "Let us make India the strongest and most prosperous with our collective efforts."

233.title: India is mother of democracy, has proved it has precious ability: PM on I-Day
233.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, during his Independence Day speech on Monday, said that India is the mother of democracy and has proved that it has a precious ability. "In this fight for Independence, struggle has continued in every corner of India...In the last 75 years, those who have died for the country...should be remembered and praised today," he added.

234.title: India sees 14,917 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate rises to 7.52%
234.article_body: India has reported 14,917 new COVID-19 cases and 32 deaths in the last 24 hours, including four reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload stood at 1,17,508, while the daily positivity rate rose to 7.52%. The COVID-19 death toll in the country reached 5,27,069.

235.title: Kartik to begin shooting for 'SatyaPrem...' in Gujarat next month: Report
235.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan will reportedly begin filming for his upcoming film 'SatyaPrem Ki Katha' in Gujarat from next month. As per the report, the shooting will take place in Ahmedabad and its outskirts. The film also features Kartik's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' co-star Kiara Advani. 'SatyaPrem Ki Katha' will be directed by Sameer Vidwans.

236.title: Blast leaves 5 dead in Ecuador; govt blames organised crime
236.article_body: Five people were killed and at least 16 others were injured in an explosion that took place in Ecuador's port city of Guayaquil on Sunday, officials said. Following the incident, the country's government blamed the blast on organised crime, officials added. Ecuador's Interior Minister said that this is a "declaration of war" against the state by "organised crime mercenaries".

237.title: In pics: Monuments across India illuminated in Tricolour lights
237.article_body: Monuments and heritage buildings across India were illuminated in Tricolour lights on the eve of the Independence Day. The buildings in this collection include India Gate, Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, Gateway of India, Humayun's Tomb, Ghanta Ghar in Srinagar, Safdarjung Tomb, Sardar Sarovar Dam, Karnataka Vidhana Soudha, West Bengal Raj Bhavan, Metcalfe Hall and Victoria Memorial.

238.title: SBI hikes lending rate by 0.2% across tenors from today, EMIs to go up
238.article_body: The State Bank of India (SBI) has hiked the marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 20 basis points, or 0.2%, across all tenors, effective August 15. With the hike in rates, housing, vehicle and personal loans will become more expensive. Several banks raised their lending rates after the RBI increased repo rate by 50 bps earlier this month.

239.title: Salman Khan wishes fans on Independence Day, shares pic with national flag
239.article_body: Actor Salman Khan took to Instagram on the occasion of Independence Day and shared a picture of himself holding the Indian national flag. Along with the picture, he wrote, "Wishing everyone a very happy 75th Independence Day. Jai Hind." Actress Sara Ali Khan also wished her fans on Independence Day on Instagram Stories and shared a tricolour collage.

240.title: I'm just dreaming for more: Simona Halep after winning her 3rd Canadian Open
240.article_body: Ex-world number one Simona Halep defeated Brazil's Beatriz Haddad Maia in Toronto to win her third Canadian Open title. Simona, who won 6-3, 2-6, 6-3, will now be placed sixth in next week's world rankings. "When I started the year...I set the goal to be...[in the] top 10. And here I am...I'm just dreaming for more," said Halep.

241.title: 18% of almost 1 crore registered MSMEs are women-owned: Govt data
241.article_body: Women entrepreneurs own 18% of micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) registered in the country, according to government data. The Minister of State for MSMEs, Bhanu Pratap Singh Verma, shared the data in the Rajya Sabha. As of August 3, 2022, 17,96,408 MSMEs were owned by women out of the total 99,58,903 MSMEs registered on the Udyam portal.

242.title: Pic shows snake 'camouflaging' with dry sticks; IFS officer asks 'what do you see'
242.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan tweeted a picture of a snake camouflaging with dry sticks and leaves on what appeared to be a forest floor. "Camouflage level !! So what do you see? This snake is called as Mock Viper. Mildly venomous. See how good it is in camouflaging," the officer wrote with the picture.

243.title: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat hoists national flag at Nagpur headquarters
243.article_body: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat hoisted the national flag at the RSS headquarters in Nagpur, Maharashtra amid tight security. "Today is the day of pride and resolution. The country got freedom after a lot of struggle, it needs to be self-reliant," Bhagwat said while addressing the gathering. India will give message of peace to the world, he added.

244.title: Apple updated its policy to explicitly ban caste-based discrimination 2 years ago
244.article_body: Apple has confirmed that it updated its general employee conduct policy about two years ago to explicitly prohibit caste-based discrimination. The company added caste alongside existing categories such as race, religion, gender, age and ancestry. Apple reportedly updated its policy after Cisco was sued on behalf of a low-caste engineer who accused two higher-caste bosses of blocking his career.

245.title: We have to keep India first, this will pave way for a united India: PM Modi
245.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi in his Independence Day speech at the Red Fort said, "We have to keep India first, this will pave way for a united India." He also asked Indians to take the pledge to work towards the development of India, to erase all forms of colonial baggage and to display pride in the heritage of the country.

246.title: Length of tenure doesn't matter, your contribution matters: Justice Lalit
246.article_body: Justice UU Lalit said that length of tenure doesn't matter, it's about one's contribution. Hindustan Times quoted Justice Lalit as saying, "The length of the tenure doesn't matter to me. Every person gets a different tenure in the institution and I believe it's your contribution that matters." "Whatever you may do has to be at the institutional level," he stated.

247.title: May we continue to grow & become stronger: Shilpa on Independence Day
247.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty took to Instagram and shared a video on the occasion of Independence Day. Along with the video, she wrote, "Happy Independence Day. May we continue to grow and become stronger over the next 75 years to come." Shilpa, who recently featured in 'Nikamma', will next be seen in Rohit Shetty's directorial 'Indian Police Force'.

248.title: Didn't get help till 6 am, couldn't connect to police helpline: Mete's driver
248.article_body: Vinayak Mete's driver, Eknath Kadam, said they got delayed response after accident. "Accident took place at around 5 to 5:15 am...Till 6 am, we did not receive any kind of help except for a small tempo, driver of which stopped to help me. I was trying to call the police helpline number 100 but I could not connect," he said.

249.title: Taiwan thanks India, others for support amid tensions with China
249.article_body: Taiwan has expressed gratitude to India and other nations over their calls for exercising restrain and avoiding unilateral actions to change the status quo amid tensions with China. "Taiwan will continue to enhance its self-defence capabilities while maintaining close communication and coordination with the US, Japan and all other like-minded nations including India," it added.

250.title: boAt celebrates its ‘1 million Make In India milestone' of manufacturing
250.article_body: boAt celebrates the manufacturing of 1 million made-in-India units through its Rock'In India campaign. For this campaign, boAt collaborated with Mayur Jumani to bring out the music created using the symphony of factory sounds showcasing India's dedication to Make and Rock In India, it said, adding that it becomes the only brand in its category to achieve 1 million mark.

251.title: Corruption & nepotism are 2 big challenges we face today: PM Modi on Independence Day
251.article_body: PM Narendra Modi in his Independence Day speech said, "Two big challenges we face today are corruption and 'parivaarwaad' or nepotism." He said, "Corruption is hollowing the country like a termite, we've to fight it." He added, "We've to raise awareness against 'parivaarwaad' to realise the strength of our institutions, to take the country forward on the basis of merit."

252.title: In next 25 yrs, we'll build a tech hub better than Silicon Valley: Vedanta chief on I-Day
252.article_body: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal took to Twitter on the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day. He wrote, "This is India's moment...From start-ups to sports, our youth have surpassed the world’s expectations. In the next 25 years, we'll build the world's leading technology hub, even better than Silicon Valley. With disruptive technology, we'll soon transform ourselves into an Atmanirbhar Bharat."

253.title: Youth in India is brimming with potential & highly motivated: Kartik Aaryan
253.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has said the current generation of India wants opportunities from the country. "The youth in India...is brimming with potential, equipped with an advanced skill set and above all hardworking to the core," he stated. "They're highly motivated, ambitious with a go-getter attitude," he added. Kartik said with the right opportunities, there's nothing youth in India can't do.

254.title: BEST's ₹1 travel plan extended till August 31 in Mumbai
254.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) announced that it will extend its 'freedom plan' for Mumbaikars till August 31. "Around one lakh Mumbaikars used ₹1 BEST freedom plan in the last 12 days," said a BEST official. The plan, which was launched on August 1, allows commuters to travel by BEST buses to any location by paying ₹1.

255.title: I feel Shubman is being groomed as opener for 2023 ODI World Cup:
255.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Deep Dasgupta has said KL Rahul should open India's innings in the three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe. "Rahul needs to get a lot of batting time...[But] I think it'll be a short-term arrangement as Shubman, I feel, is being groomed as opener for the ODI World Cup," he stated. Rahul hasn't played any competitive cricket since IPL 2022.

256.title: People of India want positive changes at quick pace: PM Modi
256.article_body: Addressing the nation on Independence Day on Monday, PM Narendra Modi said an aspirational society is an asset to any country. "We're proud that today in every corner of India aspirations are high," PM Modi added. "The people of India want positive changes...they want it at a quick pace. They also want to contribute towards it," he stated.

257.title: US Prez releases statement on I-Day, says, 'India & US are indispensable partners'
257.article_body: US President Joe Biden has released a statement extending wishes to India on Independence Day, saying, "The US joins the people of India to honor its democratic journey, guided by Mahatma Gandhi's enduring message of truth and non-violence." "India and the United States are indispensable partners...Our partnership is further strengthened by the deep bonds between our people," he added.

258.title: Man crashes car, fires shots in air then kills self near US Capitol
258.article_body: A 29-year-old man shot himself dead after crashing his car into a barricade and firing shots into the air near the US Capitol on Sunday, police said. Following the crash, the car became engulfed in flames as the man got out, the police added. "At this time, it doesn't appear...man was targeting any members of Congress," police further said.

259.title: Woman accidentally becomes owner of 84 US houses instead of 1 after typo
259.article_body: A woman accidentally became the legal owner of an entire neighbourhood of 84 homes in the US after a typo error caused these properties to be included with the house that she bought. While she paid $594,481 for the property, faulty documents revealed that her purchase included an extra 84 properties and two common spaces estimated at around $50 million.

260.title: We don't think on those lines: Pant on competition with Karthik for T20 WC spot
260.article_body: India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant, on being asked about the competition with Dinesh Karthik for a spot in India's playing XI in the upcoming T20 World Cup, said, "We don't think on those lines." He added, "[It] depends on the coach and the captain." Both Karthik and Pant have been named in the squad for the Asia Cup.

261.title: Our daughters are biggest hope for nation: President Murmu
261.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu said that in most other well-established democracies, women had to wage long-drawn struggles to get the right to vote but India can be credited to have helped the world discover the true potential of democracy. "Our daughters are the biggest hope for the nation," President Murmu said on Sunday. Gender inequalities have reduced in India, she stated.

262.title: Pune signal waiting time increased from 90-120 seconds to 150-180 seconds
262.article_body: The Pune Traffic Police Department has extended signal waiting times at main chowks of the city to decongest and monitor traffic jams, reports said. The waiting time which was 90 to 120 seconds has now increased to 150 to 180 seconds. "The number of vehicles has increased...and so we need to keep finding ways to manage traffic," police said.

263.title: After 75 years, we've heard the sound of Made-in-India weapon in I-Day gun salute: PM Modi
263.article_body: During his Independence Day speech, PM Narendra Modi said, "After 75 years, we've heard the sound of a Made-in-India weapon in the Independence Day gun salute. I salute the Armed Forces for this feat." For the first time, a home-grown howitzer gun, Advanced Towed Artillery Gun System (ATAGS), was used for the 21-gun salute during the ceremony at Red Fort.

264.title: Vicky's 'Uri..' name inspired by Hrithik's in Lakshya, had same surname: Dhar
264.article_body: Filmmaker Aditya Dhar said he loves the movie 'Lakshya' and that actor Vicky Kaushal's name in 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' was inspired by actor Hrithik Roshan's name in 'Lakshya'. "Vicky's name in [Uri: The Surgical Strike] is...Vihaan Singh Shergill...[it] was inspired from Hrithik Roshan's name in 'Lakshya', which was...Karan Shergill," he said, adding that it was his tribute to 'Lakshya'.

265.title: US Congressional delegation visits Taiwan amid tensions with China
265.article_body: A five-member US Congressional delegation arrived in Taiwan on Sunday for a two-day visit amid tensions with China. This comes after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan earlier this month. Taiwan's Foreign Affairs Ministry shared pictures of the lawmakers' arrival on Twitter and said, "We thank the like-minded US lawmakers for the timely visit and unwavering support."

266.title: Issue of pending cases needs to be tackled at various levels: Justice Lalit
266.article_body: The issue of pending cases needs to be tackled at various levels, Justice UU Lalit said. Hindustan Times quoted Justice Lalit as saying, "When a criminal appeal remains pending in SC, it gives rise to tertiary litigation...One pending matter will beget more cases at different levels. Therefore, need is to tackle the one pending before the SC at the earliest."

267.title: He planned smooth transition to sustain his legacy: Jhunjhunwala's stock trading firm
267.article_body: Rare Enterprises, the stock trading company owned by Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, issued a statement after the demise of the billionaire investor. "True to his nature...he had planned and...executed a smooth transition to sustain and enhance his legacy," the firm said. Calling him a "true nationalist", it added, "His unwavering belief in Indian entrepreneurs and enterprise will certainly outlive him."

268.title: Hyderabad to face 36-hour water supply shutdown from Aug 16
268.article_body: The Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (HMWSSB) said that over 3.5 lakh residents under the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) limits will be affected by the disruption of water supply for 36 hours starting August 16. The water supply will be hit for completing electric work and flyover construction being undertaken as part of Strategic Road Development Project.

269.title: I have 1 request to all Indians, change the mentality towards our women: PM Modi
269.article_body: During his address at Red Fort on Independence Day, PM Narendra Modi said, "I have one request to every Indian. Can we change the mentality towards our women in everyday life?" Adding that respect for women is an important pillar for India's growth, he stated, "Pride of Nari Shakti will play a vital role in fulfilling the dreams of India."

270.title: 2 women, 5 men pose as Mumbai Police in Delhi, rob wellness company; held
270.article_body: Two women and five men were arrested for allegedly posing as Mumbai Police personnel in Delhi and robbing a wellness company on August 10. "All of them were wearing Mumbai Police identity cards around their necks...They collected the employees' mobile phones and forced Yadav [owner of company] at gunpoint to call his wife and ask for the money," police added.

271.title: India needs to be a developed nation in next 25 years: PM Modi on Independence Day
271.article_body: Addressing the nation on Independence Day on Monday, PM Narendra Modi said that India needs to be a developed nation in the next 25 years. "I urge the youth to dedicate the next 25 years of their lives for the development of the nation. We will work towards even the development of the entire humanity," he added.

272.title: Jhunjhunwala had vision to back English Vinglish when no one did: R Balki
272.article_body: Filmmaker R Balki remembered late billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala and called him a great partner. "I was looking for a co-producer for 'English Vinglish'. That's when he came on board...our film was able to roll," he stated. Balki added that Jhunjhunwala had the vision to back 'English Vinglish' when many in the industry didn't have the confidence to do so.

273.title: BEST asked to pay ₹36 lakh to Mumbai man who lost his leg in road mishap
273.article_body: A Motor Accident Claims Tribunal (MACT) has ordered the Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) to pay over ₹36 lakhs to a 31-year-old man who lost his right leg after a BEST bus hit his motorcycle in Malad in 2017. The man Aslahuddin Shaikh claimed that the bus was rashly driven and had hit his bike from the rear.

274.title: PM Modi lists 5 resolves for the countrymen for the next 25 years on Independence Day
274.article_body: PM Narendra Modi in his Independence Day speech listed five resolves for the countrymen for the next 25 years. They are: Developed India, removing every ounce of gulami (slavery) in us, pride for our glorious heritage, unity and fulfilling our duties. PM Modi said, "I urge the youth to dedicate the next 25 years for the development of the nation."

275.title: India is mother of democracy, our nation's strength is in diversity: PM Modi at Red Fort
275.article_body: Addressing the nation from Red Fort on Independence Day, PM Narendra Modi said, "India is the mother of democracy." "Our nation has proven that we have the inherent strength coming from our diversity and the common thread of patriotism that makes India unshakeable," he added. PM Modi hoisted the National Flag on Independence Day for the ninth straight time.

276.title: At least 300 employees at TikTok previously worked for Chinese state media: Report
276.article_body: As many as 300 current employees at TikTok and its parent company ByteDance previously worked for Chinese state media publications, as per a report. The report added that 15 of these employees currently work for both organisations. Meanwhile, a ByteDance spokesperson said that the company "does not allow employees to hold second or part-time jobs or any outside business activity".

277.title: PM Modi hoists National Flag at Red Fort on Independence Day for 9th straight time
277.article_body: PM Narendra Modi today hoisted National Flag for the ninth straight time at the Red Fort on the occasion of Independence Day. Only former Prime Ministers Jawaharlal Nehru (17), Indira Gandhi (16) and Manmohan Singh (10) have hoisted the National Flag at Red Fort on Independence Day more times than PM Modi. India is celebrating its 76th Independence Day today.

278.title: Inspired by movie 'Special 26', 7 pose as policemen to rob centre in Delhi
278.article_body: Police have arrested seven men for taking inspiration from the Bollywood movie 'Special 26' and robbing a wellness centre in Delhi, police said on Sunday. On the pretext of conducting a raid, they robbed the complainant and his family of ₹5-7 lakh. The accused left with cash, a laptop, 10 phones and bank documents of the victims.

279.title: Water level in Gujarat's Narmada Dam rises, 23 gates opened
279.article_body: The water level in Gujarat's Narmada Dam crossed 135.2 metres, just 2.57 metres short of the Full Reservoir Level of 138.68 metres. Authorities opened 23 of the 30 gates of the dam and released about 1.94 lakh cusecs of water. With this, the level of the Narmada river rose, prompting flood alerts in Narmada, Vadodara and Bharuch districts.

280.title: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's last rites held in Mumbai
280.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, who passed away at the age of 62 on Sunday, was cremated at the Banganga Crematorium in Mumbai's Malabar Hill. Jhunjhunwala passed away after a sudden cardiac arrest, as per a doctor. He was suffering from chronic kidney disease and was on chronic dialysis, the doctor stated. He had also undergone an angioplasty recently.

281.title: BJP leader booked for holding Tiranga Yatra in Delhi without permission
281.article_body: BJP leader Kuljeet Singh Chahal was among six people booked for conducting a Tiranga Yatra without permission during the deployment of VIP carcade rehearsal in Delhi, officials said. A case was registered at Tughlak Road police station under sections 186 and 188 of the Indian Penal Code. Across the country, Tiranga Yatras are being undertaken to mark Independence Day.

282.title: 2,162 new COVID-19 cases, 5 deaths reported in Delhi
282.article_body: Delhi logged 2,162 new cases of COVID-19 on Sunday with a positivity rate of 12.64%, according to data shared by the health department. The national capital also recorded five deaths due to the infection. The city's daily caseload remained above the 2,000-mark for the 12th consecutive day. Delhi now has 8,430 active COVID-19 cases.

283.title: 63-year-old Kerala Catholic priest arrested for molesting minor boy
283.article_body: A 63-year-old Catholic priest has been arrested in Kerala for allegedly molesting a minor boy, police said on Sunday. The accused was arrested based on a complaint lodged by the boy's parents, police said. A case was registered under relevant sections of the POCSO Act, police added. The accused is reportedly a priest at a church near Varapuzha.

284.title: Was trying to emulate Yuvraj: Ryan Burl on his 34-run over against Bangladesh
284.article_body: After scoring 34 runs off an over against Bangladesh in a T20I earlier this month, Zimbabwe batter Ryan Burl said that he was trying to "emulate" former Indian batter Yuvraj Singh. "When I tried to hit the [Bangladeshi] left-arm spinner for 36 [runs]...a little bit of flash came when Yuvraj hit Broad for six sixes...he's obviously a legend," Burl said.

285.title: Nitish doesn't stands against Modi; both Kamandal, Mandal are with BJP: Sushil
285.article_body: BJP leader Sushil Modi has said that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar "has no standing in front of" PM Narendra Modi. "Nitish has nothing outside Bihar and his influence as the state's leader is also diminishing," Sushil said. He added, "Both Mandal and Kamandal are with BJP...PM Modi represents the aspirations of OBCs in the country."

286.title: Her face has peace of Shimla, but her aggression puts batters in trouble: PM on Renuka
286.article_body: Talking about India Women pacer Renuka Singh, who was the highest wicket-taker at CWG 2022, PM Narendra Modi said, "Nobody had the answer against the swing of Renuka Singh Thakur." He added, "Her face has the peace of Shimla and the smile of mountains but her aggression puts the top batters in trouble." Notably, Renuka hails from Shimla.

287.title: IMD predicts light rainfall around Red Fort on Independence Day
287.article_body: The area around Delhi's Red Fort is likely to witness light rainfall and strong winds on Monday, which is also Independence Day, IMD said.  Strong winds occasionally reaching the speed between 20-30 km per hour are likely to prevail between 6 am and 12 noon, IMD added. Notably, the Prime Minister's Independence Day speech is delivered from the Red Fort.

288.title: Yes he made millions but I'll remember him for patriotism: Mahindra on Jhunjhunwala
288.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra on Sunday paid homage to ace investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala who passed away today, saying he will remember him for his "unshakeable patriotism". "Yes, he made millions...But my strongest memory will always be...his unwavering belief in India," said Mahindra. "I wish he had made it to the 75th anniversary of our Independence," he added.

289.title: Messi picks Real Madrid's Benzema as favourite to win Ballon d'Or
289.article_body: PSG forward Lionel Messi has picked Real Madrid's Karim Benzema as the favourite to win the 2022 Ballon d'Or. "I don't think there is a single doubt...it's clear Karim Benzema had an unbelievable year," said Messi. Messi, the record seven-time winner of the award, was left out of the 30-player shortlist for this year.

290.title: Chinese and Thai air forces begin joint training exercise
290.article_body: Air forces of China and Thailand commenced a joint training exercise on Sunday at Thailand's Udorn Air Force Base. The exercise has been code-named "Falcon Strike 2022", Xinhua reported. It will include drills such as air support, strikes on ground targets, and troop deployment. Both sides have reportedly sent fighter jets and airborne early warning (AEW) aircraft for the exercise.

291.title: People with disabilities take part in a fashion show in Delhi, pics surface
291.article_body: Fashion Design Council of India (FDCI) and NGO Tamana recently organised an annual fashion show, titled Fashion Beyond Boundaries, which saw people with disabilities taking part in the show. Celebrity designers such as Anju Modi, Rajesh Pratap Singh and others were seen participating. FDCI president Sunil Sethi called the fashion show an "evening of courage and style".

292.title: Asked for extra pay, the brand said it doesn't hire dusky girls: Smrithi
292.article_body: 'Raksha Bandhan' actress Smrithi Srikanth shared that during her modelling days, a brand refused to pay her extra because of her skin tone. She recalled she was shortlisted for two of their projects. However, when she demanded extra pay, she was told that the brand does "not hire dusky girls". "They basically preferred fairer girls," she said.

293.title: Remains of Indian Army soldier found 38 years after he went missing in Siachen
293.article_body: The mortal remains of a soldier who was part of Operation Meghdoot in Siachen in 1984, were found at a bunker on Saturday. Lance Naik Chandra Shekhar from Uttarakhand's Haldwani had gone missing during the operation 38 years ago. His family, who were informed of the discovery on Sunday, are expected to get his mortal remains on Tuesday.

294.title: Shubman Gill might bat at no. 3 vs Zimbabwe in ODIs: Devang Gandhi
294.article_body: Ex-BCCI national selector Devang Gandhi said India batter Shubman Gill might have to bat at number three in upcoming ODI series against Zimbabwe. Gill opened for India in recent three-match ODI series against West Indies. "While he has done exceedingly well in...Caribbean ODIs, what I can gauge from this team's philosophy is to prepare players for multiple slots," he added.

295.title: Dhoni said 'Bhajju pa, aap vahan se daaloge', I got a wicket: Harbhajan on WC semi vs Pak
295.article_body: Recalling 2011 World Cup semi-final against Pakistan, ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh revealed how MS Dhoni's advice led to a wicket. "After a water break, Dhoni told me, 'Bhajju pa, aap vahan se daaloge' (around the wicket). Umar Akmal and Misbah-ul-Haq were playing good," he added. "On the very first ball...I got Umar's wicket...as I bowled around the wicket," Harbhajan added.

296.title: Policeman killed in grenade attack in J&K's Kulgam district
296.article_body: A policeman was killed in a grenade attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district on Saturday, the police said. The policeman Tahir Khan succumbed to his injuries at an Anantnag hospital. This came hours after a Sub-Inspector was wounded in a separate attack on a CRPF bunker in Srinagar. Khan joined J&K Police in 2019 and hailed from Poonch's Mendhar.

297.title: FPIs invest ₹22,452 crore in Indian equities between Aug 1-12
297.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) invested ₹22,452 crore in Indian equities between August 1-12 amid softening inflation concerns, data with depositories showed. This comes after FPIs turned net buyers for first time in July after a 9-month selling streak. They had invested ₹4,989 crore in July 2022. Between October 2021 and June 2022, FPIs sold ₹2.46 lakh crore from Indian equities.

298.title: Saudi Aramco posts $48 bn quarterly profit, reportedly highest-ever for a listed firm
298.article_body: Saudi Aramco on Sunday said that its net income for the second quarter surged to $48.4 billion, driven primarily by higher crude oil prices. This is the biggest quarterly adjusted profit reported by any listed company globally, as per Bloomberg. The oil and gas company, which is nearly entirely state-owned by Saudi Arabia, is among the world's most valuable companies.

299.title: Adivi Sesh visits anti-terror Special Force Octopus campus ahead of I-Day
299.article_body: Actor Adivi Sesh, who was seen in the film 'Major', recently visited the Octopus Special Forces campus to celebrate Independence Day. The OCTOPUS was established in 2007 along the lines of the National Security Guards (NSG) to counter terrorist activities. Calling it a "surreal experience", Adivi said, "I salute soldiers' efforts, who are always looking out for our safety."

300.title: Working with Aamir isn't difficult, he's very clear about what he wants: Naga
300.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya in a recent interview opened up about his experience of working with Aamir Khan in 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and said that working with the actor is not difficult. "He's very clear about what he wants, or what he set out for that scene, or that episode," he added. 'Laal Singh Chaddha' marked Naga's debut in Bollywood.

301.title: Arijit Singh to start free English coaching centre in Murshidabad: Reports
301.article_body: Singer Arijit Singh is reportedly starting an English coaching centre in Jiaganj, Murshidabad. As per sources, the singer visited a local nursing college to enquire if a room is available for rent to conduct the English classes, which will be free of cost. Shankar Mondal, to whom the college belongs, said Arijit "needed space from 6-8 am".

302.title: J&K launches 75 homestays in partnership with OYO
302.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha launched 75 homestays to commemorate 75 years of India's independence in partnership with OYO. Under the project 'Crown of Incredible India', the homestays will be owned by self-help group members of Jammu and Kashmir Rural Livelihood Mission (JKRLM). Manoj Sinha added that OYO and JKRLM would build 200 more homestays by December 2022.

303.title: Age is just a number, I am proving through my actions: Sharath Kamal
303.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sharath Kamal, who bagged three gold medals at CWG 2022 at the age of 40, said, "I don’t have to say anything about age being just a number, because I am proving it through my actions!" He added, "These last two weeks were my best two weeks of performance in my career."

304.title: 347 police personnel awarded medals for gallantry; CRPF gets most awards
304.article_body: On the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day, 347 Police Medal for Gallantry (PMG) were awarded to police personnel, with Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) receiving 109 medals, the highest of any paramilitary or state police force. J&K Police received 108 PMGs, the highest among states and UTs. A total of 1,082 police personnel were given various awards this year.

305.title: Never seen in football: Arsenal manager on fans' reaction to own goal
305.article_body: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta said that he has never seen "such support" from fans after defender William Saliba scored an own goal in the team's 4-2 win over Leicester City. "The way they reacted was something I've never seen in football," said Arteta. The Spaniard added that the team couldn't wait to play in front of the crowd again.

306.title: 2 arrested for alleged rape of 17-year-old girl in UP's Pilibhit
306.article_body: Two men were arrested for allegedly raping a 17-year-old girl in the Bisalpur area of Uttar Pradesh's Pilibhit, police informed on Sunday. According to police, the men have been accused of raping the minor while she was on her way to coaching on Saturday. An FIR was registered by the girl's father under IPC section 376 (Rape) and POCSO Act.

307.title: Taliban didn't form inclusive govt: EU ahead of takeover anniversary
307.article_body: Ahead of the first anniversary of Taliban seizing power in Afghanistan, EU External Action Service (EEAS) said that the Taliban failed to form an inclusive political system in the country. "[Taliban's]...abuses include extrajudicial killings, arbitrary arrests and detentions. Freedom of opinion, expression, press, peaceful assembly and association are being violated," the EEAS said in a statement.

308.title: Ishaan, Mrunal and Priyanshu Painyuli's 'Pippa' to release on Dec 2: Report
308.article_body: Director Raja Menon's 'Pippa', starring Ishaan Khatter, Mrunal Thakur and Priyanshu Painyuli, will reportedly release in theatres on December 2. According to the report, the makers will unveil the teaser on August 15. The upcoming film will feature Ishaan as retired Brigadier Balram Singh Mehta, who fought against Pakistan in 1971's Battle of Garibpur.

309.title: Couldn't skip event despite rain as it'd be linked to Partha: WB CM
309.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, at an event, said she attended the programme despite heavy rainfall as people would otherwise think she skipped it due to MLA Partha Chatterjee's arrest. "Some could say, someone is behind the bar and that is why I skipped this programme," she said. Chatterjee was arrested by ED in the West Bengal school recruitment scam.

310.title: I'm happy Serena Williams is retiring on her terms: Childhood coach Macci
310.article_body: Serena Williams' childhood coach Rick Macci has said he's happy that the 23-time Grand Slam champion is retiring "on her terms". He added, "It doesn't surprise me...she has a lot of things going on." The 40-year-old recently announced that she will be retiring after US Open 2022. Serena won her first Grand Slam title at US Open 1999.

311.title: Lalu Yadav to return to Bihar on Wednesday ahead of floor test
311.article_body: RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav, who is recovering in Delhi from a hairline fracture, will travel to Patna on Wednesday to meet party leaders and possibly CM Nitish Kumar. The politician is also expected to travel to Hajipur on Friday in connection with a court case. This comes ahead of the JDU-RJD alliance facing a floor test on August 24.

312.title: We could join Bihar Cabinet if given honourable representation: CPI
312.article_body: The Communist Party of India (CPI) said it could be a part of the Bihar Cabinet if given "honourable representation". CPI's Atul Kumar Anjan said they had "nothing to do with the stand" of other Left parties to only offer outside support to the new Grand Alliance Bihar government. Kumar, however, did not elaborate on the party's exact demands.

313.title: Maha govt officials to say Vande Mataram on receiving calls: Minister
313.article_body: All officials of the Maharashtra government will have to say "Vande Mataram" instead of 'Hello" while receiving phone calls in offices, state Cultural Affairs Minister Sudhir Mungantiwar said on Sunday. A formal government order will be out by August 18, he added. Mungantiwar said the decision has been taken as India is celebrating Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav.

314.title: Attack on police post in Pak's South Waziristan leaves 1 dead
314.article_body: A Pakistani police personnel was killed while another was wounded in a militant attack on a police post in South Waziristan tribal district on Saturday, local media reported on Sunday. According to media reports, the attack occurred in Azam Warsak near the Pakistan-Afghanistan border. Heavy weapons were used in the attack, police officials said.

315.title: Govt pursued those who cheated banks, brought back money: Sitharaman
315.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday said the Centre has ensured that those who cheated banks and fled were pursued and made to face justice. "We ensure that...their properties are auctioned and the money is given back to the banks and that is happening continuously," Sitharaman added. The government is dealing with legacy problems of previous governments, she further added.

316.title: Tickets for India vs Pak, all other Asia Cup games to go on sale from Monday
316.article_body: Tickets for Asia Cup 2022 match between India and Pakistan and all other matches will go on sale from Monday. Asia Cup is scheduled to begin on August 27 in UAE, with Sri Lanka taking on Afghanistan in the tournament opener. India will face Pakistan in a Group A match on August 28. India are the defending champions.

317.title: England's coach doesn't even like their 'Bazball' slogan: Elgar
317.article_body: South Africa's Test skipper Dean Elgar has commented on the newly-coined 'Bazball' term used for the current England Test team. "I think it can go...south very quickly. Their own coach (Brendon McCullum) doesn't even like the slogan they've come up with," Elgar said. He added, "I'd like to see them (English batters) do it (bat aggressively) against our seamers."

318.title: Paytm records loan distribution annual run rate of ₹25,000 cr
318.article_body: Digital financial services company One97 Communications, which operates under the Paytm brand, said that the loan distribution business recorded an annual run rate of around ₹25,000 crore in July. In June, the company reported annual run rate of around ₹24,000 crore for the loan distribution business. Paytm disbursed 29.46 lakh loans in July 2022.

319.title: Startups reduce spending on online marketing by 30-60%
319.article_body: Amid a funding crunch, most startups have reduced their spending on online marketing by 30-60%. Speaking to Moneycontrol, founders and investors in the startup ecosystem said that they have cut down on digital marketing on Google and social media platforms without an impact on the revenues. The limited marketing budgets have instead been refocused on retargeting existing customers.

320.title: Indian Army dog who died to save soldiers' lives last month gets gallantry award
320.article_body: Indian Army's assault dog Axel who had died in the line of duty has been awarded the 'Mention in Despatches' gallantry award on India's 76th Independence Day. The 2-year-old Belgian Malinois was shot thrice during a counter-terror operation in J&K last month. He died while carrying out a risky room intervention thereby saving soldiers' lives.

321.title: 'Pushpa' music composer DSP to hoist Tricolour at Times Square in New York
321.article_body: Devi Sri Prasad aka DSP, who composed music for 'Pushpa: The Rise', will hoist the Tricolour at Times Square in New York on Independence Day. "I'm...honoured to be invited as...guest of honour for the ceremonial lighting of Empire State Building & Indian flag hoisting at Times Square," he tweeted. The event has been organised by the Federation of Indian Associations.

322.title: Nykaa appoints Vishal Gupta executive VP for consumer beauty brands
322.article_body: FSN E-commerce ventures, the parent company of Nykaa, has appointed IIT Delhi and IIM Bangalore alumnus Vishal Gupta as the executive Vice President for its consumer beauty brands.Gupta joined Nykaa after working with Unilever for 25 years. He has nearly three decades of experience in the FMCG sector across India, Indonesia, Southeast Asia, and Russia.

323.title: We will have fully realised our freedom fighters' dreams by 2047: Prez
323.article_body: By 2047, India will have fully realised the dreams of her freedom fighters, President Droupadi Murmu said in her maiden address on the eve of India's 76th Independence Day. "We're already on course to build an Aatmanirbhar Bharat, an India that would have realised its true potential," she said. "After independence, all the generations have toiled hard," she added.

324.title: Fun, curious & a millennial mess: Siddhant Chaturvedi on ‘Kho Gaye…’
324.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi wrapped Zoya Akhtar's 'Kho Gaye Hum Kahan'. The actor described it as a "fun, curious and a millennial mess". He thanked the team for "the best filming experience" and called his co-stars Kalki Koechlin, Ananya Panday and Adarsh Gourav his "friends for life". "I have only grown working alongside you both," he wrote.

325.title: Kashmir's first-ever multiplex cinema to open in early September
325.article_body: The first multiplex theatre in Kashmir is set to open in the Valley's Sonawar area in early September. According to the owner, the complex will have three movie halls with a total capacity of 520 seats and multiple food courts. The building has come up at the site where the Broadway single-screen theatre used to be located.

326.title: Ayodhya priest tries to burn Pak flag in UP; police intervene
326.article_body: A priest from Ayodhya was stopped by the police as the former was allegedly trying to burn the national flag of Pakistan in UP's Barabanki on Sunday. The priest, Mahant Paramhans Acharya, allegedly tried to set the flag ablaze while addressing his followers at a function before police intervened. Later, he was sent back to Ayodhya, police said.

327.title: Water enters Cuttack's Bhattarika temple due to floods in Odisha
327.article_body: Incessant rain has led to flooding in many parts of Odisha including Cuttack where water entered the Bhattarika temple. Over 1,000 people were evacuated as gates of the Hirakud Dam were opened, leading to flooding in Sambalpur. Several areas around the Mahanadi river have also been inundated, with 21 areas reporting 116.8 mm to 204.4 mm of rainfall.

328.title: Indian taekwondo players Afreen, Shivansh win bronze medals at Israel Open G2
328.article_body: Indian taekwondo players Afreen Hyder and Shivansh Tyagi won bronze medals at the ongoing Israel Open G2 tournament. Afreen bagged the bronze in women's 62 kg weight category, while Tyagi won it in men's 74 kg weight category. Both Afreen and Tyagi are the top ranked Indian athletes in their respective weight categories.

329.title: YouTube plans to launch online store for streaming video services: Report
329.article_body: Alphabet's YouTube is planning to launch an online store for streaming video services, the Wall Street Journal reported. YouTube has renewed talks with entertainment firms about participating in the platform, which is reportedly being referred to internally as a "channel store". The platform could reportedly be available as early as this fall.

330.title: Vicky's name in Uri was inspired by Hrithik's name in Lakshya: Aditya Dhar
330.article_body: 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' director Aditya Dhar has revealed that actor Vicky Kaushal's name in the film, Vihan Singh Shergill, was inspired by Hrithik Roshan's name in 'Lakshya', which was Karan Shergill. "I really love Lakshya, so in my own way I paid a small tribute to that film by giving Vicky's character the same surname," Aditya further said.

331.title: Beating retreat ceremony held at Attari-Wagah border on I-Day eve
331.article_body: The beating retreat ceremony took place at the Attari-Wagah Border in Punjab's Amritsar on the eve of India's 76th Independence Day on Sunday. A huge crowd had gathered at the Attari-Wagah border for the ceremony. People sang songs of patriotism, danced and hoisted the Indian national flag.

332.title: Attack on Salman Rushdie is result of Iranian incitement: Israel
332.article_body: Condemning the recent stabbing of 'The Satanic Verses' author Salman Rushdie, Israel has termed the attack the result of "decades of incitement" by Iranian regime. "Attack on Salman Rushdie is an attack on our freedoms and values," Israeli PM Yair Lapid has tweeted. Rushdie, who was stabbed during a literary event in New York, was taken off ventilator on Saturday.

333.title: 80% firms globally have suffered a cyberattack in last 1 year: Study
333.article_body: A study by technology firm Acronis has showed that 80% of firms it surveyed suffered a cybersecurity breach in last one year, up from 68% from the previous year. Meanwhile, 9% of the firms also experienced at least one cyberattack/hour. The study further states that three in 10 surveyed companies reported facing a cyberattack at least once a day.

334.title: Kuwait appoints its first ambassador to Iran since 2016
334.article_body: Kuwait has appointed its first ambassador to Iran since 2016, both countries confirmed on Sunday. Ambassador Bader Abdullah Al-Munaikh presented his credentials to Iran's Foreign Minister on Saturday, Iranian foreign ministry's website said. Kuwait had recalled its ambassador to Iran in 2016 when Saudi Arabia broke diplomatic ties with Iran.

335.title: Yogi Adityanath overwhelmed to see Independence Day participation
335.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said it was "overwhelming to see every section" participate with enthusiasm in celebrating Independence Day week. He added that all "must work together to build an India we dream of" with the 'Nation First, Always First' mantra. Adityanath said UP had the responsibility to celebrate in a grand manner as it was the most populous state.

336.title: Cong MP shares pics of Pt Nehru's handwritten 'Tryst with Destiny' I-Day speech
336.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh shared pictures of a handwritten draft of first PM Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru's famous 'Tryst with Destiny' speech, delivered on the eve of India's Independence on August 15, 1947. "He had penned it as 'date with destiny', but in a moment of true genius, delivered it as 'tryst with destiny'," said Ramesh. The draft is dated 14/08/1947.

337.title: Always a big advantage when there's no Bumrah: Kaia ahead of ODIs vs India
337.article_body: Ahead of India-Zimbabwe three-match ODI series, Zimbabwe batter Innocent Kaia said there's always a big advantage when pacer Jasprit Bumrah is not playing for Team India. "He's the number one bowler in the world. So, of course, for us to not face him is an advantage," he added. Bumrah has been rested for the series due to a back injury.

338.title: Salman Khan asked me to not be a part of 'Bhaijaan': Aayush Sharma
338.article_body: Actor Aayush Sharma said it was Salman Khan's decision to not let him be a part of 'Bhaijaan'. Aayush shared that Salman thought working on the film right after 'Antim' "would dilute the importance" of them coming back together on screen. "He said 'why don't we wait for some time, get something else and then we come together,'" Aayush concluded.

339.title: Ranveer wins Best Actor award for ’83’ at Indian Film Festival of Melbourne
339.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has won the Best Actor award for '83' at the latest edition of the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne (IIFM). In the Kabir Khan directorial, Ranveer played the role of former Indian cricket captain Kapil Dev. Reacting to the win, Ranveer said the film will "always be one of the most cherished films" in his filmography.

340.title: Govt, policy-makers deserve credit for helping economy flourish: Prez
340.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu, while addressing the country on the eve of Independence Day, said the government and policy-makers deserve credit for beating global trends and helping the economy flourish. She said a new India has risen in recent years, more so after the COVID-19 outbreak. It was her first address to the nation on the eve of Independence Day.

341.title: Woman's body found buried in field in Gorakhpur; husband booked
341.article_body: The body of a 28-year-old woman was found buried in a field after a local noticed a foul smell in Pipra Miglan village in Gorakhpur, UP. The deceased, Radhika Nishad, had a rift with her husband, Amit Nishad, and had been living with her mother Gita Devi, police said. The husband was booked after a complaint was filed by Devi.

342.title: Remarkable: PM Modi on video of 'Human Tiranga' formation at height of 15,000 feet
342.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to react to a video shared by DRDO showing the first-ever skydiving formation of 'Human Tiranga' at a height of 15,000 feet above the ground level. "Remarkable," PM Modi wrote. The formation was created by Aerial Delivery Research and Development Establishment, Agra as part of celebrations of India's 75 years of independence.

343.title: Women are breaking many glass ceilings: Prez Murmu on I-Day eve
343.article_body: Ahead of India's 76th Independence Day, President Droupadi Murmu in her maiden speech said that gender inequalities have reduced in India, adding that "women are breaking many glass ceilings". "Our daughters are the biggest hope for [our] nation," President Murmu further said. Notably, President Murmu, who took charge on July 25, is the first tribal woman to become India's President.

344.title: OTT has given a new lease of life to many including me: Chak De! actress Vidya
344.article_body: 'Chak De! India' actress Vidya Malavade, who was recently seen in show 'Dr. Arora', has said OTT has changed things for everyone. "It has given a new lease of life to many including me," she added. Vidya further said the last three-four years have turned the tables for her, adding, "I'm enjoying every bit of my work at the moment."

345.title: I miss you every day papa: Riteish on Vilasrao's death anniversary
345.article_body: Actor Riteish Deshmukh on Sunday remembered his father and former Maharashtra CM Vilasrao Deshmukh on his death anniversary. "It's been 10 years...I miss you every day Pappa," he wrote. Actress Genelia Deshmukh, wife of Riteish, also penned a note remembering Vilasrao and wrote, "I know you've been with us through our toughest times and laughed with us through...lighter times."

346.title: I was an IPL newbie, they had more trust in me: GT's Kishore on Hardik, Nehra
346.article_body: Sharing his experience of playing under Gujarat Titans captain Hardik Pandya and head coach Ashish Nehra in IPL 2022, spinner Sai Kishore said both of them are "genuine". He added, "The wickets in Mumbai were great and playing another spinner didn't make sense. I was an IPL newbie and they had more trust in me after I played two games."

347.title: BJP panchayat member arrested in Uttarakhand paper leak case
