347.article_body: BJP panchayat member Hakam Singh Rawat was arrested on Sunday in connection with the Uttarakhand Subordinate Service Selection Commission (UKSSSC) paper leak. Police said Rawat is one of the masterminds of the leak. UKSSSC conducted a written exam on December 4 and 5 in 2021 and this was the biggest examination of the commission for 854 posts.

348.title: Minor, on way to meet her brother on Raksha Bandhan, gang-raped in Bihar
348.article_body: A minor, who was on her way to her brother's house to celebrate Raksha Bandhan, was gang-raped in Bihar's Siwan. She was kidnapped by four persons, taken to a bush along the roadside and raped. The accused fled after a passerby came close to the crime scene upon hearing the girl's screams. The passerby admitted the girl to the hospital.

349.title: Keyword for India today is compassion for needy: President on I-Day eve
349.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu, in her maiden address to the nation on the eve of Independence Day on Sunday, said, "Keyword for India today is compassion for downtrodden, for needy and for those on margins." She added that in the past few years, a new India has taken shape. "Gender inequalities are reducing...women are breaking many glass ceilings," the President said.

350.title: Cheteshwar Pujara smashes his highest-ever one-day score, slams 20 fours and 5 sixes
350.article_body: Indian batter Cheteshwar Pujara on Sunday smashed his highest-ever score in one-day cricket. The 34-year-old scored 174(131) against Surrey while representing Sussex in a Royal London One-Day Cup 2022 match. He slammed 20 fours and five sixes. Pujara's previous highest List A score had come on September 30, 2012, when he hit 158*(126) for India B against India A.

351.title: Savarkar proposed 2 nation theory, Jinnah supported it: Cong to BJP
351.article_body: Hours after the BJP shared a video blaming Jawaharlal Nehru for partition, Congress on Sunday responded by claiming that Veer Savarkar was the one who proposed the "two-nation theory", which was supported by Jinnah. "These people are divisive. What was their role in the independence of the country?" asked Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel.

352.title: 1 dead, 36 injured as explosion hits market in Armenia's capital
352.article_body: One person was killed and 36 others were injured after an explosion ripped through the Surmalu market in Armenia's capital Yerevan on Sunday, setting off a large fire, Armenia's emergency response ministry confirmed. The explosion reportedly occurred at a fireworks storage area. It was not immediately known what caused the fireworks to ignite.

353.title: SRK, Gauri Khan join Har Ghar Tiranga campaign, pose with Tricolour at Mannat
353.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan and his wife Gauri Khan joined the Har Ghar Tiranga campaign. Gauri shared a picture of herself, Shah Rukh and their sons Aryan and AbRam posing with the Tricolour at their house 'Mannat'. Several other celebrities including Salman Khan, Alia Bhatt, Kartik Aaryan, Mohanlal, Vivek Agnihotri and Neil Nitin Mukesh, also joined the campaign.

354.title: Amber hired me to find bad things about Depp, fired me when I came empty handed: Detective
354.article_body: Investigator Paul Barresi has revealed actress Amber Heard hired him to find bad things about her ex-husband Johnny Depp. "Amber hired me in the summer of July 2019. I searched on every rock, every stone, all over the world to find out bad things about Johnny," he added. He further said that she fired him after he came empty handed.

355.title: ITBP to scale 75 peaks, go on 75-day patrol to mark 75 yrs of independence
355.article_body: Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) personnel will scale 75 peaks on Independence Day and complete a 75-day-long patrol along the LAC with China to mark 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' celebrations, a senior officer said. The mountain expedition will cover 33 peaks in Ladakh and 16 in Uttarakhand, among others. The patrol, which started on August 1, will conclude on October 14.

356.title: Probing threat made to JK Rowling over Rushdie tweet: Scotland Police
356.article_body: Scottish police have said they're investigating a report of an online threat made to author JK Rowling over her tweet condemning the stabbing of author Salman Rushdie. Enquiries are being carried out, a spokeswoman for Scottish police said. "Feeling very sick...let [Rushdie] be ok," Rowling had tweeted, in response to which a user wrote, "Don't worry you are next".

357.title: Delhi CM Kejriwal, Deputy Sisodia attend 'Har Hath Tiranga' event
357.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Deputy CM Manish Sisodia attended the 'Har Hath Tiranga' programme on Independence Day eve. Kejriwal said that India has completed 75 years of Independence but it is still running behind several countries, including those that got freedom after India. Kejriwal added that we can take India to the top if we all work together.

358.title: Media reports on 'war game' with Pak Navy are false: Sri Lankan Navy
358.article_body: The Sri Lankan Navy has refuted certain media reports terming its passage exercise with Pakistan Navy a 'war game', terming the reports to be ''fallacious". The reports come amid Pakistan Navy Ship (PNS) Taimur's proposed passage exercise with Sri Lanka Navy Ship (SLNS) Sindurala off the coast of Colombo before PNS Taimur departs from Sri Lanka on August 15.

359.title: A motivating interaction: CWG 2022 gold medallist Sharath on meeting PM Modi
359.article_body: After meeting PM Narendra Modi at his residence, Indian table tennis player Sharath Kamal, who won three gold and one silver medals at Commonwealth Games 2022, said it was a motivating interaction with the PM. "Support extended to the fullest and encouraging words from...leaders of our nation ignites greater fire within to win more medals for the country," he added.

360.title: Cong to get 3 ministerial berths in new Bihar govt: AICC's state in-charge
360.article_body: AICC's Bihar in-charge Bhakta Charan Das has informed that Congress will get three ministerial berths in the newly-formed Bihar government. "Two Congress legislators will take oath on 16 August...One more party legislator will be inducted in the Nitish Kumar cabinet when the next expansion takes place," Das said. Notably, the Grand Alliance comprises seven parties and over 160 legislators.

361.title: Don’t think I’d repeat that: Tamannaah on glamorous roles
361.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia said she has starred in films where female leads were seen as the love interests or the eye candies. The actress said that while she doesn't look down upon such films, she doesn't "want to repeat" them. Tamannaah also thanked the OTT platforms for allowing her to explore roles that she "could not do 10-12 years go".

362.title: Varun Dhawan is a complete package: Naga Chaitanya
362.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya, who made his Bollywood debut with 'Laal Singh Chaddha,' said Varun Dhawan will be a perfect fit to star in his film 'Tadakha' if it is ever remade in Hindi. The actor said Varun can act and dance well, which makes him "a complete package". 'Tadakha', a Kishore Kumar Pardasani directorial, was released in 2013.

363.title: Conceded goals from individual mistakes: Man Utd manager on loss to Brentford
363.article_body: After losing their Premier League match to Brentford by 4-0 on Saturday, Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag said that they "conceded goals from individual mistakes". "Brentford were more hungry," Hag said. The 52-year-old Dutchman added, "After 35 minutes we conceded four goals. This is not possible...You can't have a tactical plan but then put it in the bin."

364.title: Ace investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala had produced 3 Bollywood movies
364.article_body: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, who passed away today, had produced three Bollywood films. He produced the 2012 film 'English Vinglish', which marked the late Sridevi's return to movies after a long hiatus. He also produced the 2015 release 'Shamitabh' with Amitabh Bachchan and Dhanush in lead roles and 'Ki&Ka', which was released in 2016 and starred Kareena Kapoor Khan and Arjun Kapoor.

365.title: Come together without any biases: Rajinikanth on 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign
365.article_body: As a part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign, actor Rajinikanth has requested his fans to hoist the national flag outside their homes as a mark of respect to the freedom fighters. "I request you all to come together without any caste, religious, and political biases and fly our national flag on a small pole outside our homes," he said.

366.title: A visionary, a true patriot: Anil Kapoor on Rakesh Jhunjhunwala
366.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor on Sunday remembered his "dear friend" and late billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. Calling Jhunjhunwala a "true patriot" and a "visionary", Anil tweeted that he "loved films and music" and was "a well-wisher" of the actor's family, especially of his daughters Rhea Kapoor and Sonam Kapoor. "Will miss him dearly," Anil concluded. Jhunjhunwala passed away on August 14.

367.title: AC Milan and Inter Milan turn down chance to sign Ronaldo: Report
367.article_body: Italian clubs AC Milan and Inter Milan have rejected the chance to sign Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo, a report said. This comes after earlier claims that teams like Atletico Madrid, Bayern Munich, and PSG did not wish to sign the five-time Ballon d'Or winner. Ronaldo played in both of United's 1-2 and 0-4 losses against Brighton and Brentford, respectively.

368.title: Hope Shane Warne's proud: Alana King after her hat-trick in The Hundred
368.article_body: Australian leg-spinner Alana King said she hoped the late Shane Warne was proud of her after she took the first-ever hat-trick in the women's edition of The Hundred. "I hope (Warne)...is pretty proud I spun it a bit," said King. The hat-trick came at the same Old Trafford ground where Warne bowled the ball of the century in 1993.

369.title: Unvaccinated Djokovic withdraws from Western and Southern Open in Cincinnati
369.article_body: World number six Novak Djokovic has withdrawn from next week's Western and Southern Open in Cincinnati due to his COVID-19 vaccination status. The 35-year-old has not gotten any COVID-19 vaccine shots and is not allowed to travel to the US. Djokovic has said he won't get vaccinated against coronavirus, even if that prevents him from playing in certain tournaments.

370.title: Beti Bachao was a pretence: Cong to BJP over 'unfulfilled' promises
370.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday criticised the BJP over its "unfulfilled" promises to the family of the Hathras victim, who died after being gang-raped by four men. Rahul said that the 'Beti Bachao' slogan was just a "pretence" and that BJP has never hesitated in doing "injustice" to women.

371.title: Don't give it too much attention: Chhetri to teammates on FIFA ban threat
371.article_body: Indian men's football team captain Sunil Chhetri has advised his teammates to "not give too much attention" to FIFA's suspension threat to the All India Football Federation (AIFF). "My advice is to not give it too much attention because it's out of your control," said Chhetri. FIFA's warning came after claims of third-party "influence" in the Indian body.

372.title: What is this 'Swachh Bharat' if it cannot restore dignity to Indians?: Yechury
372.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury has criticised the Centre for allegedly being unable to stop the practice of manual scavenging. "This obnoxious indignity must end...[In] 1993, manual scavenging [got] banned...[and in] 2013 PEMSRA [was] enacted...Yet three [people] die at work every five days," Yechury tweeted. "What is this 'Swachh Bharat' if it cannot restore dignity to Indians?" he asked.

373.title: No work, no pay: HC on teacher’s plea for salary during his imprisonment
373.article_body: Bombay High Court has rejected the plea of a retired teacher who sought a salary for the period he was jailed for allegedly murdering his wife. The court said the principle of "no work, no pay" would apply to the case. The teacher was arrested for the alleged killing of his wife and convicted in 2008 for the offence.

374.title: Probe video of inspector assaulting man: Women's body to Pune Police
374.article_body: Maharashtra State Commission for Women said that it has directed the Pune Police Commissioner to probe a purported video showcasing a senior police inspector assaulting and hurling abuses at a man. The inspector, Rajesh Puranik, led several raids to bust online gambling rackets recently. The purported video was filmed during questioning of the accused in one such raid, officials said.

375.title: 8-foot-long crocodile enters residential colony in MP, video surfaces
375.article_body: A video surfaced online showing an eight-foot-long crocodile inside a residential colony in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri. The crocodile entered the colony amid heavy rainfall. According to SDPO Ajay Bhargava, a rescue team from Madhav National Park caught the crocodile after an hour-long effort. According to officials, the crocodile must've entered the colony from an overflowing drain.

376.title: Kartik dances & plays tug of war with Indian Navy officers, shares videos
376.article_body: Kartik Aaryan spent a day with some officers of the Indian Navy ahead of Independence Day and shared pictures and videos from his visit on his Instagram handle. In the videos, the actor can be seen playing tug of war, dancing and making rotis on a roti-making machine. Kartik was also seen posing with a gun in his hand.

377.title: B'luru woman calls police after sensing life threat; found dead later
377.article_body: An 83-year-old woman was found dead at her residence on Saturday in Bengaluru's HSR Layout 1 area. The 83-year-old woman had called the police multiple times and alleged that she faced the threat of being murdered. The woman's diamonds have also been stolen by the attackers, police investigation revealed. The security guard is on the run, reports said.

378.title: Tata pens note for Jhunjhunwala, says 'he'll be remembered for his kindness'
378.article_body: Businessman Ratan Tata penned a note to condole the death of billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. "[He] will always be remembered for his acute understanding of the stock exchanges of India," said Tata, adding, "He will always be remembered for his jovial personality, his kindness and his foresightedness." Jhunjhunwala passed away aged 62 on Sunday.

379.title: 4 held with MD worth ₹29 lakh in Guj; supplier based in Mumbai
379.article_body: Four persons were arrested allegedly with mephedrone (MD) worth ₹29 lakh, while they were bringing the banned drug from Mumbai to Ahmedabad in Gujarat, a police official said on Sunday. The two accused travelled to Surat on a bus belonging to a travel agency and then reached Ahmedabad along with the other two accused, a police release informed.

380.title: Minor-led group held for burglary in Hyd, items worth lakhs seized
380.article_body: A minor and his two adult accomplices were arrested by police in Hyderabad on Saturday for allegedly committing burglary at the house of the minor's employer. The minor allegedly planned the burglary that took place on August 8. Police reportedly recovered cash and valuables, including jewellery and a car, of a combined worth of ₹23 lakh from the group's possession.

381.title: K'taka CM is RSS' slave: Siddaramaiah on exclusion of Nehru from govt ad
381.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah called Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai an "RSS slave" over the exclusion of Jawaharlal Nehru from the list of freedom fighters in the government advertisement published in newspapers on Sunday. "Not including Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru in the list of freedom fighters in today's government ad shows how low a CM can go to save his chair," he said.

382.title: Janhvi remembers mom Sridevi on her birth anniversary, shares throwback pic
382.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor took to Instagram on Saturday to share a post remembering her late mother, veteran actress Sridevi, on her birth anniversary. Sharing a childhood picture of herself with her mother, Janhvi wrote, "Happy birthday Mumma. I miss you more and more every day." Sridevi passed away in 2018 while she was in Dubai to attend a family wedding.

383.title: 2 B'deshi nationals held in Delhi with 11 passports, fake govt stamps
383.article_body: The Delhi Police have apprehended two Bangladeshi nationals from the city's Palam area and recovered from them several passports as well as 10 fake stamps belonging to various Bangladesh ministries, according to an official. "On search, [the accused] were found to be in possession of 11 passports of different Bangladeshi citizens...About the...stamps, they had no substantive answer," police said.

384.title: 6 of top 10 most valued firms added ₹1.56 lakh cr to m-cap last week
384.article_body: The combined market capitalisation (m-cap) of six of the top 10 most valued firms surged by ₹1.56 lakh crore last week. While Reliance Industries, Tata Consultancy Services, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, HDFC and Bajaj Finance recorded gains in their m-cap, Infosys, Hindustan Unilever and Life Insurance Corporation suffered losses. Reliance Industries' m-cap rose the most to ₹17.81 lakh crore.

385.title: Railways to hold heritage run of 167-year-old steam engine on I-Day
385.article_body: Indian Railways will hold a heritage run of a 167-year-old locomotive, which is the world's oldest working steam engine, on Independence Day. The special service will run between Chennai's Egmore and Kodambakkam railway stations. "The beautiful sound of the whistle will send you back to the times of the steam locomotive from the days gone by," Divisional Railway Manager said.

386.title: B'luru Traffic Police shares list of roads to be avoided on I-Day
386.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police has shared a list of roads to be avoided on August 15 due to various Independence Day events. It has been advised to avoid taking Cubbon Road from 7 am to 11 am. As per the advisory, MKK Road, Tumkur Road, Vatal Nagraj Road, and Rajkumar Road will remain affected between 8 am and 12 pm.

387.title: BlueBenx dismisses staff, suspends withdrawals after $32 mn hack: Report
387.article_body: Brazilian crypto lender BlueBenx laid off a majority of its staff and barred withdrawals of all its 22,000 members after an alleged theft of $32 million in cryptocurrency, Cointelegraph reported. An anonymous investor reportedly said there's a high probability of it being a scam as the theft "seems like...something they invented". BlueBenx had guaranteed up to 66% returns on cryptocurrency.

388.title: Such a dexterous actor: Russo Brothers on Dhanush's performance in 'Jagame...'
388.article_body: Russo Brothers have praised Dhanush's performance in his 2021 action movie 'Jagame Thandhiram'. "He is such a dexterous actor. He is able to do this very intense action, while at the same time holding on to an attitude and almost a casualness in this character," Anthony Russo said. The filmmaker duo worked with Dhanush in the film 'The Gray Man'.

389.title: Ex-Pak PM Imran plays Jaishankar's clip in rally, says 'This is an independent country'
389.article_body: During a rally in Lahore, ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan played a clip of an interview of India's External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and said, "This is what an independent country is." In the clip, Jaishankar responded to criticism of India buying Russian oil, saying, "Our total purchases for the month would be less than what Europe does in an afternoon."

390.title: At least 40 people killed after massive fire inside a church in Egypt
390.article_body: At least 40 people have been killed and several others have been injured after a massive fire broke out inside a church in Egypt. The fire erupted when around 5,000 worshippers had gathered for the mass at the Coptic Abu Sifin church in the Imbaba neighbourhood. The fire blocked an entrance to the church, causing a stampede.

391.title: 791 new cases of COVID-19 logged in Bengaluru on Saturday
391.article_body: Bengaluru reported 791 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Saturday with a positivity rate of 6.48%, as per data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike chief Tushar Giri Nath. The cases took Bengaluru's active case count to 6,781. No new deaths due to the infection were recorded on Saturday. With the addition of the new cases, Bengaluru's COVID-19 tally reached 18,50,840.

392.title: Militant attack thwarted in Manipur ahead of 76th I-Day; 7 arrested
392.article_body: At least seven militants of the banned People's Liberation Army have been arrested from across Manipur ahead of India's 76th Independence Day, police said on Sunday. The Assam Rifles had received inputs about the outfit's plot to target government installations and security forces with explosives on August 15, police said. Ammunition including hand grenades has been seized, police added.

393.title: 'Totally unacceptable': Kerala Guv on Jaleel's 'Azad Kashmir' remark
393.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Sunday criticised remarks made by LDF leader KT Jaleel on Kashmir and said it was "totally unacceptable". Jaleel kicked off a row after he shared a Facebook post, where he called Jammu and Kashmir "Indian adheena Jammu and Kashmir" (India-Occupied Jammu and Kashmir) and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir "Azad Kashmir".

394.title: Portfolios allocated in Maha; CM keeps Urban Development, Fadnavis gets Home & Finance
394.article_body: Portfolios were allocated to Maharashtra ministers on Sunday as Chief Minister Eknath Shinde kept Urban Development, Information and Technology, and Information and Public Relations, among other portfolios. Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis got Home, and Finance and Planning, among other ministries. Shambhuraj Desai got State Excise, Uday Samant got Industries and Mangal Prabhat Lodha got Tourism.

395.title: He's in same bracket as Woods, Muhammad Ali: Raza on Kohli's comparison vs Babar
395.article_body: Zimbabwe all-rounder Sikandar Raza praised Virat Kohli as he compared the India batter with Pakistan captain Babar Azam, saying he would like to put Kohli in the same bracket as Tiger Woods and Muhammad Ali. "These people kind of revolutionised their sports, they thought outside the box and they tried something new which was later followed by everybody," he added.

396.title: Rahul Gandhi is silent: BJP leader after Dalit boy's death in Rajasthan
396.article_body: After a nine-year-old Dalit boy was beaten by his teacher leading to his death for drinking water from the latter’s pot in Rajasthan, BJP’s Y Satya Kumar said Congress' Rahul Gandhi "who has commented on every subject of the country is silent" on this matter. "This incident...is embarrassing. Incidents of atrocities on Dalits are...increasing in the state," Kumar tweeted.

397.title: 2-time champion Halep beats US' Pegula to reach 4th National Bank Open final
397.article_body: Two-time champion Simona Halep entered the final of National Bank Open, beating US' Jessie Pegula  2-6, 6-3, 6-4 in the semi-final in Toronto on Saturday. This is Halep's fourth final at the tournament. Halep will face Brazil's Beatriz Haddad Maia, who beat 14th-seeded Karolina Pliskova of the Czech Republic 6-4, 7-6(9-7) in the other semifinal.

398.title: WhatsApp working to let users set avatars as display pics: Report
398.article_body: WhatsApp is working on a feature which would let users set an avatar as a display picture, WABetaInfo said. It has obtained a screenshot which showed how the feature would allow users to customise avatars and choose a background colour. WhatsApp was reportedly working on a feature to allow users to answer video calls using an animated avatar.

399.title: Man suffers burn injuries as electric bike explodes in Hyderabad
399.article_body: A man sustained burn injuries on his hands and other parts of the body after his electric bike exploded in Hyderabad's Vanasthalipuram on Saturday evening, news reports said. The incident reportedly occurred in NGO colony when 33-year-old Koteshwar Rao turned on the switch to charge his two-wheeler. Rao was rushed to a nearby hospital where he is undergoing treatment.

400.title: 20-yr-old woman jumps from building after friend rapes her in Mumbai
400.article_body: The Vashi Police arrested a 28-year-old man for allegedly raping a 20-year-old woman after offering her food laced with drugs. The woman jumped from the fourth floor of her residence following the incident and sustained multiple injuries and fractures. API Kamlakar Sontake of Vashi police station said that the accused and the victim know each other.
